name: Late coming Excuses
description:
Late coming Excuses is a skill to suggest you some unique excuses in case of getting late at work..

You can say:

"Alexa, load Late coming Excuses"
"Alexa, open Late coming Excuses"
"Alexa, tell Late coming Excuses"
"Alexa, start Late coming Excuses"
"Alexa, launch Late coming Excuses"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at shirishkalbhor@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: it would only give me one excuse and then kept going back to intro

name: Space X Info
description:
This skill tells you the date and time of the next SpaceX launch. It also gives you the name of the rocket and the payload, if any, it is carrying.
It makes use of the SpaceX Data REST API (https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API).
review: A launch is scheduled for today 2/5/18. Skill says Jan. 31.

name: Halloween Countdown
description: Tells the number of days until Halloween. Just ask, "Alexa, open Halloween Countdown."
comment heading: Works great, tells you when its 50% Off Candy Eve
review: This works perfectly, enabling me to figure out just how many days there are until Halloween which is the day before the big 50% Off Candy Holiday!

name: MyStopwatch
description:
A stopwatch app for Echo devices that has Start, Pause, Resume, Current Time, and Stop.


To start: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to start.'
To pause: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to pause.'
To resume: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to resume.'
To get the current time: 'Alexa, ask my stopwatch for the current time.'
To stop: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to stop.'
To get help: 'Alexa, ask my stopwatch for help.'

After each command (except for starting), Alexa will inform you of the current time of your stopwatch.
comment heading: Need to Improve the Recognized Requests
review: I can't simply ask such things as, "How much time is on my stopwatch". Still might be the best stopwatch option until Alexa adds a stopwatch as a native feature as it does with timers.

name: Timezone
description:
Timezone is a simple skill that can answer questions like: 

 - "What time is it in Tokyo?",
 - "What is the time difference between New York and Cape Town?", and
 - "How many hours is San Francisco behind New York?"

name: Russian Bells
description: The unique & entrancing sound of the Kremlin and other Russian Orthodox churches.
review: Excellent Bell Clarity! clear, reasonanting bells.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review:
this app is crap! Alexa does NOT remember anything she's supposed to!
Alexa needs a Major Update!

name: Carpool Helper
description: This Alexa Skill can keep track of the days that you drive for your carpool and remind you in the mornings. Currently, it works with carpools based on days of the week (i.e. One person drives on certain days, and other drives on other days). The first time, the app will guide you through the setup process, then you can ask it if you are driving the carpool today, or if you are driving on a certain day (for example "Am I driving carpool tomorrow?" or "Am I driving carpool on August 10th?"

name: Binary Conversion
description: Ask alexa to convert a number into it's binary quivalent, and alexa will read back the sequence of 1's and 0's back to you. You can ask "what is the binary of 16?" and alexa will read back "The binary for 16 is 1, 0, 0, 0, 0"
review: Interesting

name: Particle Cloud
description: Connect to your online Particle Photon, Electron and Core devices, get and set variables and call cloud functions using your Alexa device
review: Doesn’t work at all. It can list online devices on my account, beyond that nothing.

name: English jokes
description:
english  jokes  is a skill to help you _____________________.

You can say:

"Alexa, open english jokes "
"Alexa, start english jokes "
"Alexa, launch english jokes "

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at _____________. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: just plain dumb

name: How Many Days
description:
Open the skill and Alexa will automatically tell you how many days remain until all your upcoming events. Alexa can also remind you about the exact date for a specific events.
This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.
review: does what its supposed to 🤷‍♀️

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
comment heading: Confuses the number zero for letter O
review: Great idea but it says the letter O when in fact it's the number zero

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
comment heading: Great skill if you know the tricks to using it.
review: This is a great skill if you know how to use Any.do. You can set up a list with any name on the Any.do mobile app or website. You can also turn off Moments or whatever they call it on the mobile app. The things people don't like about this skill are almost always fixable if you know where to go on the app or website to fix it.

name: Deep Sleep Sounds
description:
Click the 'Enable' button or say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds'. Then you can say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds' to begin skill.

Sleep well at night or bring peace to your busy life with Relaxing Sounds. Close your eyes and relax. These sounds are good for meditation or relaxation.

We use a high quality 2 hour audio stream, not 2 min loops with pauses some other sound providers use.

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!
review: very relaxing. so needed after the frustrating attempts to run the app. first you ask her to open the app. then she asks you if you want to open the app. then you need to guess the exact correct second to time your yes reaponse. and for the record, “yes damn it all to hell” does not work.

name: BS Alert
description:
Click the 'Enable' button or say 'Alexa open bs alert'. Then you can say 'Alexa open bs alert' to begin skill.

I'm sure we have all felt the need to use something like this skill before - simply activate and your good to go next time someone talks rubbish you can have alexa call them out! 

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!
review: funny skill

name: Safe Place
description:
Ever forgotten the safe place you put your passport last year? Now you can get Alexa to remember for you!

Safe Place remembers where you put those important things for you, simply tell Safe Place "my passport is in the safe" or "remember that my certificate is in the desk drawer".
When you come to need it next simply ask Safe Place "where's my passport?"

Want to update the location of an item?  Simply tell Safe Space the new location the same way you told it where it was before. 

To get Safe Space to forget an item's location just tell Safe Place "Forget my passport" or if you want it to forget everything, "forget me".

I hope you find Safe Place useful, thanks for checking it out!

name: NYC Garbage Collection
description:
Tells you if garbage collection is in effect today in New York City.



This skill is using data from NYC 311 service.
Not Affiliated with the New York City Government or NYC 311 Service.
review: ... but can't tell you future status

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
review: I wrote the commands in black marker over the usual place where we keep the calendar, so now it's useful.

name: Tweech for Twitter
description:
This skill reads your twitter timeline to you.
Tweech is your personalized flash briefing. You can easily stay up to date with updates that are are relevant for you.
Start your day hearing what the people you follow talk about and get news in real time as you expect it from twitter.

If you want to receive specific information just open a new twitter account and follow the relevant accounts. You can configure you own flash briefing in seconds.

Only english tweets are read. For a better experience the tweets are cleaned up.
After you have activated the skill you will be asked for a read-only access to your twitter account.

Feel free to send us feedback, bugs or feature request to twitter@futureofvoice.com
review:
Love this skill, it's very useful but would be 10/10 better if it could read tweets from my twitter list rather than my home feed.
I have a list for VIPs that I really care about keeping up to date with. It would nice to know what they tweet rather than having all the other accounts I follow in the mix.

name: Baby Weight Tracker
description: As a parent whose children needed careful weight monitoring as babies, I found that trying to juggle the scale, my phone, and the baby, to keep track of daily weights and understand the recent average trend, was often more than I could handle in my sleep-deprived state :) So I wanted to make a simple skill that does just this one thing easily. Weigh your baby with your home scale, say "open baby weight," and then for example, "ten pounds four and a half ounces," (or kilograms and grams if you like) and that's it. After the second day recording weight, you'll start to hear back the change since last time. After a week of tracking, you'll be able to say "report" and get the recent daily average change. A well-rested adult with one hand reliably free could probably do this pretty easily with a notepad :) But for those of us who don't fit that description during the first year of our children's lives, well, I hope this skill helps. Apologies but this first version can only track one child's weight at a time. One last thing, if you just want to record one quick weight, it's not necessary to open and log in separate steps. You can just say, "Alexa, tell baby weight fifteen pounds nine ounces." Happy tracking!

name: Phone Number Check
description:
the skill provides basic information about a 10 digit phone number in the United State:
1. type of call: land line, mobile, etc (if available)
2. carrier: if available
3. location: if available
review:
Me: Alexa tell me about “111-111-1111”
Alexa: the answer to your calculation is “1,111,111,111”
(Not what I asked)

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
review: Not until Christmas, keep wishing!  TRUMP/PENCE 2020

name: Work Clock
description:
This is a perfect skill to help keep track of your time without the hassle of manually clocking-in or out while you are working. A great tool for freelancers, consultants, or anything that requires you to keep track of your time.

Just open work clock, create a project with any name, and from there you can clock in and out of the project. If you need to record your clocked times, just ask for an email with the report, and Alexa will send it to your email!

NOTE: You need to enable account linking in order to email yourself a summary of your project times.

Below is a list of common commands:

"Create new project"
"Hear existing projects"
"Clock into 'project name'"
"Clock out of 'project name'"
"Tell me the total time of 'project name'"
"Email me a summary of all projects"
"Delete 'project name'"
"Hear all commands"

You can also easily clock-in and clock-out in one utterance:
"Alexa open work clock and clock in/out of 'project name'"

You can watch a live demo on our YouTube video here:
https://youtu.be/IMmJnrcZRhY

Any comments, questions, or suggestions? We would love to hear your feedback! Please contact us at our email - contact.xtechc@gmail.com

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)

This is a handy little app to share my guest network Wi-Fi password with visitors.

For members of the Aluminum Foil Deflector Beanie (AFDB™) crowd, I live a quarter mile from the nearest neighbor, so I'm not concerned about someone getting access. Psychotronic mind control devices probably pose a more imminent threat.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: If you follow the instructions exactly it works perfectly. Will only work at home though but hey I lose my phone there more than anywhere lol Would be nice to find a skill that would find your phone away from home.

description: Num Rand will give you a random number within a given range. Ask it for a number between two integers, and it'll generate a new random number, inclusive of the two you gave it.

name: Web Check

When you say "check amazon", it will check http://amazon.com and https://amazon.com and respond "website is up on HTTP only", "website is up on HTTPS only", "website is up on HTTP and HTTPS", or "website is down".
When you say "check my sites", it will get your site list you entered via https://alexa.agilesalt.com, and check them.

review: I’ve tried local gov skills before but they fall short. They are often overloaded with info and read poorly. This skill clearly tells me what is happening each day in my city!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: It works, but I wish one could keep the ...
review: It works, but I wish one could keep the timer displayed rather than repeatedly having to ask for status. I've no clue why this isn't a native skill on Echo devices.

name: Simple Mobile
description:
Use your Ask Simple Mobile Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Simple Mobile Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Simple Mobile Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Simple Mobile Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Simple Mobile Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check simplemobile.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Simple Mobile phone and service. Go to www.simplemobile.com for more details.
review: Every time I enter the access code that it sends to my phone it says invalid code.

name: note me (beta)
description:
The skill is in beta mode and may have some bugs, you can report bugs and give recommendations for improving the skill. 

Note me allows you to save short notes and recall them whenever you ask Alexa to play the notes or messages back to you. You can save up to 5 messages or notes. You can also delete them by saying delete. 
** Automatically registers the user on enabling skill and deletes him/her from database if all notes deleted or skill is disabled.
 
Example : 
"Alexa launch note me"
" save I am going to the store tomorrow"

" play" Alexa will play the note back You in her voice 

"Delete" Alexa will delete the messages
"Delete first note" deletes the first note only

name: Miami Bell Tower
description: This skill will tell you the time in Oxford, OH as might be told by the bell tower.
comment heading: Funny, but I wanted to hear a recording of the actual tower!
review: It would be much more interesting to hear the tower bells....

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
comment heading: As useful at keeping time as a broken watch.
review:
Until the manufacturer lets us know how to offset the time (i.e. what command to give) this is as useful as a watch that cannot be set to the proper time.

Further, since Alexa already KNOWS our timezone, this should be automatic.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com

name: My Extra Brain
description: Just ask for a quick reminder, and we'll send you a text at the time. This isn't a fancy reminder service with snoozing, repeating reminders, or any of that jazz. Just ask us, and we'll remind you. The skill works by securely storing your phone number and reminders associated with your unique Alexa userId. Then, when it's time for your reminder, we send your reminder to you via SMS. Standard text messaging rates from your carrier apply. Reminders will be sent from the number 37083.

name: World Time
description:
This skill helps customers get the current time in any city or country in the world. The user frames a question such as "Alexa, what's the time in New York?". The location is obtained from the user's utterance and 
the co-ordinates of the location are obtained using Google Maps API.
The co-ordinates are used to obtain the current time using the Google
Timezone API. The time is also adjusted for Daylight Saving wherever applicable.

name: Deep Sleep Sounds
description:
Click the 'Enable' button or say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds'. Then you can say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds' to begin skill.

Sleep well at night or bring peace to your busy life with Relaxing Sounds. Close your eyes and relax. These sounds are good for meditation or relaxation.

We use a high quality 2 hour audio stream, not 2 min loops with pauses some other sound providers use.

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!

name: Mechanical Watch Ticking
description:
Mechanical Watch Ticking is a relaxing ambient sound loop playing the sound of famous Swiss wristwatch Omega Seamaster with ETA 2892 movement. 
The subtle and pleasing sound of a ticking watch is perfect for you to relax, relieve stress, or just simply enjoy.
The skill will play the sound in a loop until you say "stop" or "pause". 




You can say:

"Alexa, open Mechanical Watch Ticking"
"Alexa, start Mechanical Watch Ticking"
"Alexa, launch Mechanical Watch Ticking"


Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at 
http://seaoflove.info/contact/. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: LunarDate
description: This skill is to convert the Gregorian date to Chinese Lunar date

name: Location Reminder
description: This skill is designed to help you remember where you put your stuff. You can tell it where your stuff is and after you inevitably forget it, you can just ask Alexa. Unfortunately this is setup for a pretty strict input structure. For making an entry say something like "My/The/... stuff is/are in/at/under/... location", and for getting reminded the command structure is "where is/are my/the/... stuff". You can also delete entries. I hope this skill helps somebody.
review: Does everything it says it is going to do. Only annoying this is she repeats the instructions every single time you open location reminder but it is very useful!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: Works well once you figure out Alexa wants to hear the Stopwatch before the command
review: It works. I had come her to figure out how to stop the thing but had lainchrd it with Alexa, start a stopwatch. She told me to say “launch stopwatch” to get the status. The bit about saying “ask stopwatch to” makes a bit of sense even though it is cumbersome. She needs to hear the word stopwatch first not the function. Kinda like RPN.

name: Assist Reminder
description:
Assist Reminder will help you remember where you have put any of your items. You can do this by telling Alexa to remember where you have put certain things. Then you can tell Alexa to remind you where you have put these things. For example, you could say, "Alexa, tell Assist Reminder I put my wallet on desk ". After which you can say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder where is my wallet" and Alexa will tell you your wallet is on your desk. This is helpful for when you can not find your things, such as your badge, laptop, headphones, etc.
To get a list of all your reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to list all".
If you don't need the reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to clear".
review: Pin Number requirement to access the hiding place info would be nice.

name: Safe Zone
description: This skill enables Alexa to provide the Safety Rating of a city.This skill can be used by travelers visiting a new city or planning to visit a new city.It can be used by parents to determine if their children are in a safe city.
review: Tried it many times and only understood San Francisco. And then you have to ask the whole thing from the top again.

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
review: This is a really great skill, now If my family or friends ask me for wifi password, I just tell them to ask Alexa. If you are concerned about people accessing your Wifi by asking Alexa, then just don't enable the skill It's a great skill for those that are always being asked for the Wifi password. Nice job on this skill :)

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: didn't work just kept repeating the list is empty!

name: Ascii Code
description:
Ask ascii code to convert any printable ascii character to a hex, decimal, octal, or binary value. Suppose you say "Convert forward slash to hex" Alexa will inform you that the hexadecimal representation of a forward slash is 2F. You may phonetic examples to clarify your request, such as "C as in charlie".

View the source code at https://github.com/samueljacobjackson/alexa-ascii-code
review: I tried this, but it seldom understood what I was asking. It kept interpreting A as 8. It thought I said I when I said E. It seemed to time out often during questions. Generally, more frustration than it was worth. Easier to just pull up an ASCII table on the computer, especially since you would normally be on the computer when you need an ASCII value..

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: Excellent!  All those silly things that float through your mind as you are doing 3 other things can now be listed on Any.do with a quick call out to Alexa.  Change the air filter, send a birthday card, throw out the fish sandwich were all verbally listed as I folded towels while watching the baby.

name: Thunderstorm Sounds
description:
Ambient sounds from nature are proven to help boost your focus at work, sleep better at night, or just help improve your mindfulness altogether.

All you need to do is say Alexa start Best ThunderStorm Sounds, and she will play the track for 60 minutes. Saying Alexa loop on will keep her playing until you say stop. This is a perfect skill to leave on while you are asleep, to use for relaxation and meditation, or to tune in and focus on your work. 

That's all there is to it! We hope you enjoy this. 

Please leave us a 5 star review if you like this skill so we can continue bringing you more great skills for free!

"Alexa, start Best Thunderstorm Sounds"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at dmsystems2016@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: Great when reading in bed at night and preparing for sleep.

name: The Mayan Calendar
description:
Itzamna' is the son of the creator god Hunab Ku, and ruler of the heavens, day, and night.  He gave the Mayans the foundations of their civilization including growing corn, writing, the calendar and medicine.
With this skill, Alexa can ask Itzamna' the current day on the Mayan calendar which consists of five interlocking cycles of different lengths called "baktun", "katun", "tun", "uinal" and "kin".

name: Air Quality
description: This skill reports the air quality index for US zip codes.  The data is sourced from the U.S. EPA AirNow program.
review: Doesn't work.  I ask it, and it plays a "du-dum" sound.

name: Particle Cloud
description: Connect to your online Particle Photon, Electron and Core devices, get and set variables and call cloud functions using your Alexa device
review: excellent job for a expected skill.  works fine

name: Pizza Calculator
description:
Pizza Calculator helps you find the best bang for the buck.

Enter the pizza information, such as price, size, and company. We will then tell you which of the two pizzas is cheaper per square inch.

If you enjoyed this skill or it helped you save money, feel free to leave an honest review below.

name: Area Code Skill
description: This skill can be used to get region information associated with any telephone number.

name: Safe Place
description:
Ever forgotten the safe place you put your passport last year? Now you can get Alexa to remember for you!

Safe Place remembers where you put those important things for you, simply tell Safe Place "my passport is in the safe" or "remember that my certificate is in the desk drawer".
When you come to need it next simply ask Safe Place "where's my passport?"

Want to update the location of an item?  Simply tell Safe Space the new location the same way you told it where it was before. 

To get Safe Space to forget an item's location just tell Safe Place "Forget my passport" or if you want it to forget everything, "forget me".

I hope you find Safe Place useful, thanks for checking it out!
review: This is just what I was looking for to help a relative with memory issues.  I am having issues with Alexa understanding what I am saying, but I am hopeful.  It would be absolutely brilliant if there was a way to feed the information in through an app.  For example: item - safe place

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!
review: Works fine for me. Understands me every time, and plays the correct pitch every time. Volume is a little too low otherwise I would give it 5 stars.

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: You do have to say Ask Age Calculator. I also could not get it to give me the number of days.

name: Random Number
description: This skill will generate a random number between 1 and 100 for you.
review: I use this to decide who goes first in games and who does the dishes, or who does anything when we cant decide.  Like paper, rock, scissors.

description:

Simply say "Alexa, start morning rooster" to wake your family. 

To stop the rooster, you have to say "Alexa, stop". 

NOTE: Contrary to some reviews and comments, this Skill *absolutely* stops when you say "Alexa, stop".   But you do have to say 'Alexa' first - this is due to the way that Amazon has implemented the audio player.

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".

46 countries (http://holidays.kayaposoft.com/) supported and support for regions will be added soon.

name: Foundmi
description:

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: mine keeps going until told to quit, I leave my phone on silent always, so is a lifesaver,one of the best ever

skills-rest: Tick Tock - Timer with Funny Celebrity Impressions
name: Tick Tock - Timer with Funny Celebrity Impressions
description:
No matter if you are baking a cake, working out or need a reminder to call your lawyer: a timer is a useful thing. Unfortunately, useful is most often boring – so we have set out to change this dire state of the Alexa timer.

Tick Tock‘s funny celebrity impression timer is employing the voices of Morgan Freeman, Sean Connery, Colin Firth, Jeff Bridges and Jack Nicolson. Have these legends tell you when time is up. They might even throw in a piece of wisdom.

Celebrated impressionist Jim Meskimen is entertaining you in this skill.
review: I downloaded this skill and loved having the option to have celebrities announce the end of my timer.  My friends are always surprised and very entertained to hear the celebrity end my timer!  Love it.

name: World Time
description:
This skill helps customers get the current time in any city or country in the world. The user frames a question such as "Alexa, what's the time in New York?". The location is obtained from the user's utterance and 
the co-ordinates of the location are obtained using Google Maps API.
The co-ordinates are used to obtain the current time using the Google
Timezone API. The time is also adjusted for Daylight Saving wherever applicable.

Amazing app!  But wMD allows me to have up to 4 devices on my wmd account.  But when using Alexa... I only have access to one wmd account. :(

Outside of that.... an amazing first start for wmd.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com

name: Delay Say

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: It doesn’t adjust for the user’s time zone, so it ends up telling me it’s 3:20AM when it’s really 10:20PM 😅

If you do not provide enough information for calculating an effective resistance, resutil will prompt you for the missing information.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: it's good. keep in mind skill apps rely on saying "ask" to the skill, the devs can't just make up phrases beyond what amazon allows, so "ask stopwatch to stop" is the correct way to address the skill and the devs are doing all they can. this rule applies to other alexa skills. the skills all seem like crap until the user internalizes the "ask" method.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: perfect

name: counting coach
description:
Counting Coach can help you if you need a sparring partner in your workouts, are practicing a choreography, playing hide and seek with your kids, or teaching them how to count.

Examples:

Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to twenty (will count in a regular 1 second pace from 1 to 20).

Alexa, tell Counting Coach to from one to eight fast (won't pause as much).

Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to 3 very slowly (will make a longer pause between numbers and pronounce slowly and more clearly).

You can ask the skill to count between two numbers and to do it slow, very slowly, fast and very fast.

Easter Egg: Try saying "Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to 10 in whale".

name: REM Sleep
description: Use this skill to find out the optimal time to wake up, based on number of REM sleep cycles.
review: The longest time it gives as a wake up is 7 hours from the bedtime....the other times are much earlier.  I don't believe this is quite accurate given sleep variations are 6 to 9 hours.  I'm not sure what waking up after a R.E.M. Cycle early on would do, since your body is cycling in and out of non R.E.M. & R.E.M. - with each R.E.M. supposedly getting longer. It seems to me you end up sleep deprived? I tried this a few times and set the alarm by the last wake time. Ultimately, I ended up falling back asleep on most occasions for longer.

name: ASCII Converter

name: Where's My Droid
description:
Use the original phone tracking app to find your phone. You can have Alexa make your phone ring on full volume or track it with the phones GPS.

Setup:
First you'll need to download the Where's My Droid app on your phone from Google Play. Run the app and setup a Commander account. You'll then log into that Commander account through the Alexa app to link your account.
review: I would really like to use this, but I can't get it to link..

name: Tweech for Twitter
description:
This skill reads your twitter timeline to you.
Tweech is your personalized flash briefing. You can easily stay up to date with updates that are are relevant for you.
Start your day hearing what the people you follow talk about and get news in real time as you expect it from twitter.

If you want to receive specific information just open a new twitter account and follow the relevant accounts. You can configure you own flash briefing in seconds.

Only english tweets are read. For a better experience the tweets are cleaned up.
After you have activated the skill you will be asked for a read-only access to your twitter account.

Feel free to send us feedback, bugs or feature request to twitter@futureofvoice.com
comment heading: My alternative for the flash briefing
review:
I enjoy the personlized news feed from twitter a lot. It contains exactly my field of interest. This skill allows me to listen to this news feed, while doing other things. It pretty much replaced the flash briefing during my morning routine.

Hopefully it brings you as much joy as it does me. If not drop me a line. I'm happy to help with issues and make this skill an even more compelling experience.

Disclaimer: I was part of the developer team.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: Works great!! As long as you say the commands correctly.

review: i just created an account in where is my droid, and then enable the skill, i have the basic app, you dont need to pay for elite version to use it with your alexa.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: I lose my phone often this is such a help. Make sure your Bluetooth is on though

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: I give it 5 star. I use it for work,  I am a dispatcher an I have several trucks that run all 48 States so I really need to know the weather and also I sent timer to remind me to call someone back an the to do list is great.

name: Location Reminder
description: This skill is designed to help you remember where you put your stuff. You can tell it where your stuff is and after you inevitably forget it, you can just ask Alexa. Unfortunately this is setup for a pretty strict input structure. For making an entry say something like "My/The/... stuff is/are in/at/under/... location", and for getting reminded the command structure is "where is/are my/the/... stuff". You can also delete entries. I hope this skill helps somebody.
review: All I can get is "your undefined undefined"... I said my keys are in the hallway.  Not ready to be a public app yet.

name: Morning Rooster
description:

To stop the rooster, you have to say "Alexa, stop".

review: Link to alarm routine plz

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.
comment heading: Works for my straight talk phone.
review: This is great. I can add airtime, check my usage, and get help with the ease of Alexa.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com
comment heading: pretty good app, it's a start
review: I've been wanting Alexa to do something like this but every 15 min. gets annoying. I would like it just on the hour

She will look for the current exchange rate and tell you what is the amount of the money that your currency represents in other countries. You can ask her too about conversion from other currencies or exchange rate from several currencies all around the world.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: I use this skill for our shopping and to do lists more than any other. Syncing lists with native iPhone is basic, but any.do adds a more sophisticated level of task management. Combine this with MS Outlook skill and organization is very useful.

name: Coin Flip
description:
Ever need to flip a coin, but you are out of cash?

Ever want to flip a weighted coin, so you get heads 30 percent of the time?

Now you can!

Simply tell Alexa to flip a coin.
Or, for custom odds, tell Alexa to flip a coin with high odds, or to flip a coin with thirty percent odds
review: Works great.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: I like the idea of having an app remember little things I don’t want to note.IT DOES WORK.... I repeat IT DOES WORK. First breath because trust me I am aware as to how irritating this app is. You must say “Add” or “Add to list” then the thing you want it to remember. No pauses. Yes it is a bit odd in process but it works. I kept saying add and add to list like the bozos in the other review and it kept repeating what do you want to do next and the list was empty. Then I did as I said above and boom it works. Good luck folks.

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
review: We all need to laugh so we don't cry.

name: Christmas Countdown
description: Tells the number of days until Christmas. Just ask, "Alexa, open Christmas Countdown."
comment heading: This skill is inconsistent with Alexa's response
review: Alexa does not agree with the number of days...could this skill be location dependent? At any rate, the skill is not needed since Alexa knows the answer without the skill.

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
review:
I wasn't too worried about sharing my network name and password. For me personally, the level of risk that some remote person might be able to use it against me in some way is extremely low, or even if it were my next-door neighbor for that matter. However, after filling out the form it gave me someone else's network name and password. What's much worse is that that the name of the wifi network makes me believe that it's very likely someone near to my location, due to the name being a local reference. They may be using IP addresses as the way to determine the network identity, and I believe I may share a public-facing IP with other people in my neighborhood using the same cable internet provider, given that I haven't paid for a private IP address. That's just a guess at how it would even be possible for me to get the wrong person's wifi network and have it be someone using a local reference as their network name. The risk for me personally is still quite low, but I can see this being a very high risk to some people.

A bug like this could threaten someone's personal safety, if they had a stalker for example.

comment heading: Does not recognizes my Annual Pass Type
review: Useless. I tried to tell it my  annual pass type, but no matter what variation I tried it won't recognize it. Useless

name: Bike Share
description:
NOTE: Bike Share only currently supports Citibike in New York City. Stay tuned for support for more bike share systems across the country!

Bike Share allows you to quickly find the closest bike share station to your address with bikes available! Use it on the way out of the house in the morning to avoid walking to an empty station. If a station has less than 3 bikes available, Bike Share will also let you know  the next station that is more populated. 

First, you need to add the address where your Amazon Echo resides. Start by saying:
"Add an Address."

Alexa will prompt you, step by step, to add your address, starting with your house number. For example, if your address was 350 5th Avenue, 10118, when prompted for your house number, you would say "three fifty".

Next, Bike Share will ask for your street name. Using the above example address, you would say "fifth avenue".

Finally, Bike Share will ask for your zip code. In the above example, you would answer, "one zero one one eight".

Once saved, you can then ask at any time to find the closest bike. Just say: "find me a bike."
Alexa will remember your address indefinitely, so you'll never need to add an address again unless you move your Echo. 

If you need to change your address, just tell Bike Share: "change my address". Alexa will ask if you want to overwrite your current address; if you respond "yes", you will be given the chance to enter a new address.
review:
Was about to build a similar functionality myself. Good to see that it's already here!

Idea for future version:
My citibike commute is the same daily—I attempt to pick up a bike from my same "home" station and attempt to drop it off at the same "work" station. Often, finding a free spot to drop it off is difficult. It would be nice to have both locales checked, so that I could ask alexa, "Alexa, ask Bike Share about my commute." And I would be given details about pickup/dropoff.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.
review: It’s a cool idea, I wish Alexa could tell me what’s on around the house where I can save more energy.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.
