name: Siren Marine
description:
The Siren Marine skill provides the ability to check the status of your connected boat (a Siren Marine subscription is required.)  The user must link their Siren Marine account, and a user selected boat, to the Alexa App in order to access their boat's information with this skill.  

You can get a full boat status by giving Alexa the following command:

Alexa, ask Siren Marine for the boat status.

A sample list of commands to query status of the most common elements is provided below.  Each of the commands begins with "Alexa, ask Siren Marine ______".

•    Boat Summary: provides a summary of the boat.

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is my boat doing? 
Alexa, ask Siren Marine for the boat information. 
Alexa, ask Siren Marine for the boat status. 

•    Battery Status: provides the battery 1 status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the battery looking?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine for the battery status. 

•    Bilge Status: provides the bilge 1 status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the bilge looking?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine for the bilge status.

•    Temperature Status: provides the temp probe 1 temperature

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine what is my boat temperature?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine to give me the boat temperature

•    Battery Status: provides the shore power

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the shore power doing/looking?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine for the shore power status/information.

•    Entry 1 Status: provides the entry 1 status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine what is my entry information?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine for the entry status.

•    Engine Status: provides the battery 1 status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the engine doing?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine what is my engine status. 

•    High Water Status: provides the high water status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the high water looking?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine what is my high water status

•    Back up battery Status: provides the back up battery status

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine how is the back up battery looking/doing?
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine what is my back up battery status. 

•    Location Status: provides the current geographic location of the boat

Alexa ,ask Siren Marine where is my boat? 
Alexa ,ask Siren Marine to give me the location of my boat.
review: A great addition to the overall functionality.  The Siren Marine team did a great job.  It was easy to link the two devices. Already recommending to friends.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
comment heading: Does what it does to the highest degree.
review:
Would never have looked  behind my bed, fantastic.  Now how  about a Alexa chip for wallet,and keys. Solved the glasses  problem,
now own thee pairs.

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: It is awesome. Almost feel like Christopher Walken is in the room, breathing down my neck and staring ominously.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: The calculator was the most fundamental aid which was missing from alexa. Things have been much easier with this simple addition. Love it !!!

name: Net10
description:
Use your Ask Net10 Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Net10 Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Net10 Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your NET10 Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a NET10 Wireless Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check net10wireless.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Net10 phone and service. Go to www.net10.com for more details.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

name: Baby Shush
description:
If your lips are falling off from the amount of soothing shushing you've been doing then Baby Shush is THE skill for you. Baby Shush uses a thoroughly tested technique designed to break a baby's cry spell and engage their natural calming reflex.

The rhythmic shush reminds baby of being inside mom, where they were inundated 24 hours a day with loud sounds of blood flow and other in utero noises (up to 95 dBs, or the sound of a very loud vacuum cleaner). What may sound harsh at first is actually very calming to a baby.

It will play on loop so you don't have to worry about baby being suddenly woken up.

You can say:

"Alexa, open Baby Shush"
"Alexa, start Baby Shush"
"Alexa, launch Baby Shush"

Please leave a review if you love this skill so other moms and dads can enjoy some peace and quiet :)

description:
Kick-start your day with this super loud alarm of a military bugle call (Reveille). Perfect as a 'wake-up' alert for yourself.

LOUD ALARMS

ROUTINE NOTE
Soon you will be able to add this Alexa Skill to your Routines. Until then, you must activate it manually when you wake up. We will let everyone know when you can add this skill as a routine!

REVIEWS
iHearFun wants you to have fun, with our mega fun & useful skills! But we really need your support to keep this skill free, so if you have a few minutes please leave a 5-star review. Thank you.

CREDITS
This sound is Public Domain from Wikipedia. 'Reveille', performed by Sergeant Codie Lynn Williams of Dallas (ceremonial bugler for Marine Barracks Washington).

name: UTC Time in Morse Code
description:
This is a simple skill to give Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time in Morse Code. It provides an another opportunity to practice listening skills.  
Details of development: I used the new beta AWS Developer Console function that develops your code inline which makes creating a new skill a no brainer and very fast. Could have done it in a couple hours had I known the syntax of subscript and how to create acceptable mp3 files for S3. As it was it took about a day to get everything done.
Found out that the mp3 file format must be 16000 and 48k or it won't work. 
Finally, it would be nice to get the user's local time and there is an API for that but unfortunately the API returns a text version of the users timezone (Like Africa) so you would need a database to look up the time offset from UTC. Too much work so this little skill just returns UTC. I know that I live in a timezone that is 8 hours ahead of UTC.
Anyway, it was a good exercise and it is nice to know it is so easy to make a skill now compared to earlier versions of AWS Skill Kit.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: Not ready for primetime. Nice concept, but 2 issues: weather doesn't work with Canadian postal codes (even though the option is there to enter it on the Mosaic site - they said it's the weather service they are using); LIFX lighting cannot set timers to turn it on (with IFTTT, I can set  timer to have my LIFX gradually turn on automatically, which is perfect for mornings). Will revisit when the weather issue is fixed. Pity! Would have been a nice workaround to Amazon's restriction to provide weather only for USA without having to specify city.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!

name: SCUBA Dive Planner
description: The Dive Planner skill gives Alexa the ability to compute custom decompression profiles for SCUBA diving.  This skill follows the philosophy that there is no such thing as a “no decompression dive”. No matter how shallow the depth or short the bottom time, by diving you will incur the poorly understood consequences of breathing mixed gasses at an atmospheric pressure well beyond our normal operating range. Care should be taken to carefully control the ascent rate and follow a decompression stop protocol for all dives, even those within recreational no-stop limits, to minimize the stresses on our bodies.
review: It won’t help if you are diving. Take Alexa on a dive boat?  Leave it on the beach?  Seriously. What are you going to do with this app? name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

name: Safe Place
description:
Ever forgotten the safe place you put your passport last year? Now you can get Alexa to remember for you!

Safe Place remembers where you put those important things for you, simply tell Safe Place "my passport is in the safe" or "remember that my certificate is in the desk drawer".
When you come to need it next simply ask Safe Place "where's my passport?"

Want to update the location of an item?  Simply tell Safe Space the new location the same way you told it where it was before. 

To get Safe Space to forget an item's location just tell Safe Place "Forget my passport" or if you want it to forget everything, "forget me".

I hope you find Safe Place useful, thanks for checking it out!

name: Simple Mobile
description:
Use your Ask Simple Mobile Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Simple Mobile Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Simple Mobile Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Simple Mobile Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Simple Mobile Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check simplemobile.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Simple Mobile phone and service. Go to www.simplemobile.com for more details.

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)

review: Great for visiting guest.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: I hope a better app for this purpose is developed.
review: Clearly the writer of this has never held a REAL stopwatch.

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: Pretty neat app....a bit like Alexa to do list but give you the option to remove items on the list by voice

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Love this skill. So easy to use. I haven't misplaced my phone in a long time.

name: Seattle Garbage Collection
description:
You can register your garbage collection day. And after registration, you can ask TRASH COLLECTOR to your today's garbage. Supported garbage type is "RECYCLE", "FOOD", "GARBAGE" and, "YARD WASTE". Collection day of week is "SUNDAY" to "SATURDAY".

[Registration]

User: "Alexa, start TRASH COLLECTOR."

Skill: "Welcome to the Seattle City Trash Collector. You can REGISTER, DELETE and CHECK the trash collect schedule. To regist, "REGISTER NEW DATA". To delete, "DELETE ALL DATA". To check, "WHAT IS TODAY'S GARBAGE?"

User:"Alexa,  ask TRASH COLLECTOR regist new data."

Skill:"Register the garbage type and collect day of week. Garbage type is {RECYCLE | FOOD | GARBAGE | YARD WASTE}."
User: "Garbage type is RECYCLE."

Skill: "I remember collect garbage type is RECYCLE. Next, register the collect day of week, collect day of week is {SUNDAY | MONDAY | TUESDAY | WEDNESDAY | THURSDAY | FRIDAY | SATURDAY}."

User: "Collect day of week is TUESDAY."

Skill: "I remember garbage type is RECYCLE, and collect day of the week is TUESDAY. Registration is finished."


[Check]

User: "Alexa, ask TRASH COLLECTOR what is today's garbage?"

Skill: "RECYCLE."

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Apps should differentiate between IOS and Android - before giving info about the app to find hint that lean to one version

comment heading: Works great, even with a Google number
review: I forward all my calls to phones through Google, which causes problems for some "Phone Finder" skills. This particular skill works perfectly. Definitely a needed. I'm autistic and lose things often. When the phone rings, my service dog goes to get it.

name: Pizza Calculator
description:
Pizza Calculator helps you find the best bang for the buck.

Enter the pizza information, such as price, size, and company. We will then tell you which of the two pizzas is cheaper per square inch.

If you enjoyed this skill or it helped you save money, feel free to leave an honest review below.
review: I was skeptical but this skill has the word "pizza" in it -- not to mention a friendly looking slice of pizza as the icon -- so I had to try it. Turns out, it was actually pretty good (just like the pizza I ate). I was afraid it would be a cheesy app that tells me facts about pizza, but instead, it was different. This skill tries to compare two pizzas to see which is the better deal. I like that it was interactive and you don't have to enter everything in one mouthful. After entering the company name, it then prompts you for the size, and finally the price, and so on.  It then tells you which pizza is cheaper per square inch. So you could compare a large and a medium by the same pizza seller, and see if you should get the large for a little more, or the medium for a little less. In my case, the large did save me a few cents per square inch.  It would be 5 stars if it could tell me how much I will save by ordering the pizza it recommends. For example it could say "the large is 2 cents per square inch cheaper. Your large pizza is xxx square inches, so you will save $1.96 by buying the large". Overall, a highly recommended app for all the pizza eaters out there. It might save you some dough. Would be interested to hear what others think. (By the way, anchovies is small fish pickled in oil, in case you are new to pizza. Does anyone actually like fish on their pizza?)

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: Tried it for 5 minutes.  Seems to handle calculations with decimals (cool).  But doesn’t show work on screen.  Disabled the skill

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: I spent over $100 for a withings scale and that's all it does? Ummm ...

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: I wish Alexa was more like Google

name: Starfish Track
description:
You can use the skill to find locations of your loved one's as well as yourself. Also you can ring a lost phone loudly even if it's on silent mode. You can ring phone's of all relatives who are linked to your household account on Starfish. To switch off sound click on the alert you receive or open our app "Starfish Mint" on your phone. You will need our mobile app and a subscribed user id to be shared between household. Every time you request someone's location they get an alert and you get to know where they are. We have apps for Android and IOS. To link your mobile phone download our app (Search for Starfish Mint or you get a link when you register on our website in our welcome pack email) and goto Mobile Services/Starfish Track section.

You can setup your skill following below steps. You will find more details on our website:

1. Register for a  www.starfishmint.com account. If you use any of our other skills then you don't need to register again. All our skills requires account linking
2. Link you alexa skill with your starfishmint.com. Account linking gets triggered when you try and enable the skill. You must link if you want to do anything beyond launch prompt
3. Login to www.starfishmint.com and subscribe for skills. If you have an active subscription then you don't need to subscribe again.
4. Download our Mobile app to all members of your household and in Mobile Services/Starfish Track section login with the same user id on all mobile devices.
5. Assign a relation name to the mobile phone. This screen is presented after login screen

. That is it you are all setup to ask Alexa for Starfish Track.
review: This is awesome skill and works like a charm

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
comment heading: Just stays in initial state. I had to disable
review:
This didn't work for me. Seems to stay in initial state.  Always just asks to set recycle week.  I waited 24 hours thinking maybe the app just is slow to update. No luck.  I had to disable. I think Amazon should consider some minimal amount of quality control to insure some functionality of these skills.

If you want this function I suggest using the echo schedule function.  I added "recycle" for several months, then I just ask what's on my schedule for the day. If it's recycle week Alexa tells me.

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street. To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
review: Once I set up my recycling week, Alexa has helped me stay on track. It's been accurate every time. I wish I didn't have to remember exactly how to ask, but otherwise this is a helpful app.

comment heading: Very handy and useful shopping list
review:
My wife and I both use this app, whoever is at the store has the complete, up to date, shopping list.  One of our favorite things about the Amazon Echo is being able to say "Alexa, add peanut butter to the shopping list", and have it appear on both our phones nearly instantly.

My only complaint is I would prefer to have check boxes for the things that were done, rather than swiping them off the screen.  It is too easy to swipe the wrong line (you can swipe it back on easily enough).

name: Location Reminder
description: This skill is designed to help you remember where you put your stuff. You can tell it where your stuff is and after you inevitably forget it, you can just ask Alexa. Unfortunately this is setup for a pretty strict input structure. For making an entry say something like "My/The/... stuff is/are in/at/under/... location", and for getting reminded the command structure is "where is/are my/the/... stuff". You can also delete entries. I hope this skill helps somebody.

review: Low Life Liberals

name: Delay Say
description: Have Alexa repeat your phrase after a delay of your choosing by saying: "Alexa, tell/ask Delay Say to say [your phrase] in/after [any delay in minutes or seconds less than 11 minutes]" . For example: "Alexa, tell Delay Say to say 'Don't forget to turn off the rice' in 10 minutes." Or, another example: "Alexa, ask Delay Say to say 'welcome home mom' after 55 seconds".
comment heading: Works, but limited to one at a time.
review: It works, but only one at a time. If you ask Alexa to do anything else before the time is up, she won't say your delay say. Also, she glows green while holding on to your message. So, my husband knew something was up. I was hoping to time it where she could say the person's name, pause, and then tell them something silly. There is no way to pause (I tried setting the delay say for 9min and then 10min. The 9min worked. The 10min one never did.)

name: Quote Maker
description:
Quote Maker is a development tool that allows developers to create notifications in real-time, and trigger the sending of SetIndicator directives to all Alexa-enabled devices connected to the associated Amazon account. When you ask Quote Maker to create a notification, a randomly selected quote is added to your notifications queue, and results in your device receiving a directive with instructions to persistently inform the user that a notification is available to be retrieved. 

To get started, simply say: 
"Alexa, open Quote Maker." 
"Alexa, ask Quote Maker to create a notification." 

To retrieve your notifications, say: 

"Alexa, what are my notifications?" 

Test notifications with the AVS device SDK: https://github.com/alexa/avs-device-sdk/wiki

name: SwiftFinder
description:
Are you always looking for something? Let SwiftFinder help you find it! Pair your things with the SwiftFinder app and Alexa can ring the things you left.

To setup:
1.) Enable the SwiftFinder Skill by SwiftFinder in the Alexa app.
2.) Download the SwiftFinder app from the Apple App Store on your smartphone.
3.) Launch the SwiftFinder app.
4.) Ask Alexa for your PIN, Just say, "Alexa, ask okay swift to generate my PIN code".
5.) Enter the PIN provided by Alexa into the SwiftFinder app and tap Submit.
6.) Ask Alexa to ring my phone
maker: by 雨燕物联(深圳)有限公司

If it doesnt work, check your mobile network." It doesn't ring my keys. My mobile network is fine. I got a key finder of the name brand that works just fine with Alexa, so it's disappointing this one doesn't.

review: This is awesome

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
comment heading: Useful, but it's a huge security risk!!
review:
Although I see this as a possibly useful skill / app, I also see the potential for a security risk if someone can possibly call the Echo / Echo Dot / Tap through a door or a window and gain access to your WiFi password.  Just a suggestion to the developer, maybe program the skill to only tell the WiFi password after verification answer to a security question, i.e. "What year did you graduate high school or College?" Or some other security barrier that only the WiFi administrator (The person paying for internet service is usually the one who sets it up) would know the answer to.  Something like, "Where were you during the famous 9/11 attacks?"

Give at least some layer of protection.  A passcode PIN, a text message sent to your tech friends maybe in lieu of voice readout of your WiFi password?  Just some friendly suggestions from a computer support tech going through college.

name: Morning Rooster
description:
Wake up to the sound of the countryside with a rooster ! 

Simply say "Alexa, start morning rooster" to wake your family. 

To stop the rooster, you have to say "Alexa, stop". 

NOTE: Contrary to some reviews and comments, this Skill *absolutely* stops when you say "Alexa, stop".   But you do have to say 'Alexa' first - this is due to the way that Amazon has implemented the audio player.
comment heading: Could not get it to stop playing
review: Had to disable the skill

name: Coin Convert
description:
Coin Convert is a crypto-currency conversion skill. It supports conversion among the top CryptoCurrencies by Market Capitalization, with Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Litecoin, and Ethereum Classic among the most popular coins today. Coin Convert also does currencies, including U.S. Dollar, Euro, British Pound, Chinese Yuan, Japanese Yen, and Korean Won.

     Usage Examples:
1) "Alexa, ask Coin Convert One Million dogecoin to U.S. Dollar"

2) "Alexa, open Coin Convert"
    "Five thousand bitcoin to litecoin"
  
     This skill uses the CryptoCompare API. Please visit https://www.cryptocompare.com/api for more information on the freely available API under Creative Commons license.
review: Cool and easy to use!

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
comment heading: Best alexa skill for a connected home
review: Amazing skill! In fact I'd say it's one of the best skills for Alexa. I just wish it connected to more things, so I could use it even more. The natural feedback as well as the quirky responses make this skill so easy and fun to use.

name: Translate This

Support for more languages, more phrases, and native pronunciation will shortly be implemented.

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.

name: Gift Ideas
description:
Ever find yourself trying to come up with good gift ideas for your friends or family members at the last minute, and you're angry with yourself because you KNOW you had a great idea for them months ago?  Well now you don't need to have that struggle any longer!  With Gift Ideas for Alexa, you can simply tell the skill your idea and it will remember it for you and when you're ready for your ideas, simply ask Alexa again.  It's that easy!

COMING SOON:
We intend to add specific birth date and event-specific gift idea tracking (i.e. you might have some ideas for someone specifically for Christmas vs. their birthday) and a Flash Briefing skill that will use those dates to remind you about shopping when those dates are getting close.  Stay tuned for more!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

description: Forget where you put your car keys? Your sunglasses? The flour? Butler is an easy-to-use item location reminder. Simply tell Butler where you put an item and Butler will remember next time you ask!
review: Works

name: Game Score
description:
Whatever game you're playing, you can now keep score without using paper and pen! Adding and subtracting are so 20th century. Let Alexa do the score keeping for you!

To start, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score to start a new game."

You can add players by saying, "Alexa, tell Game Score that Susan is playing." You don't have to add players, however, you can simply add scores for players as the game progresses.

Say, "Alexa, tell Game Score to give 5 points to Robert."

Find out the score by saying, "Alexa, ask Game Score for the score."

If you just want to know who's in the lead, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score who's winning."

To find anyone's score, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score how many points Steve has."
review: Simply fantastic. My only feedback, and I hope you can implement, is beinag able to verbalize a single utterance to link the player and add points to his/her/their/it's score. I.E "Alexa, tell Game score to add one point to John's score"....Alexa response, "One point added to John's score". Boom, don. As apposed to, "Alexa, tell Game score to add one point to John's score"... "Is the name John correct?"..."Yes" "How many points should I for John"... "Added". I am using this for a fast paced game and it takes a bit too long to add points to someone's total. Best game scoreing skill available!!!

name: Orbit
description:
Attach an Orbit to your keys, wallet, glasses or any of your belonging to find them easily. The Orbit skill is compatible with all Orbit hardware models and any Orbit-enabled products.

Say "Alexa, ask Orbit to find my phone" or "Alexa, ask Orbit to find my keys"
review: I've just updated Orbit App in my smartphone and was noticed about this new feature using Alexa voice commands. Congrats! Alexa is working 100% with Orbit skill. "Alexa, ask Orbit to ring my phone" or "Alexa, ask Orbit to find my luggage".

name: Bin reminder
description:
*NEW* Version Update 2.2! (See below)
**Now supports multiple bin types. Currently supports recycling,
black, general, green, brown, blue, pink,
white,grey,red,yellow,orange, glass and garden**

**Request a new bin type by sending email to alexaozcalendar@gmail.com**


Let Bin Reminder  know what frequency your bins go out and also do they start this week or next.

To get started, you simply need to say 'Open Bin Reminder,' and you will be guided through the flow.
Once the initial setup is configured, it will be stored for future reference.

If you move house or your bin frequency changes, no problem! You can reset and start again by saying "Alexa, ask Bin Reminder to reset".

The skill supports ISO week of the year. That means, weeks start with Monday.

To view a quick demo, check out link below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kB2EBVTSPkQ


**Feedback**:

You can email me directly at alexaozcalendar@gmail.com
 with any questions, comments or concerns.

Future releases will offer additional features based on community feedback.


Update 1.1:
-Added in day of the week as part of the initial setup. If applicable, Bin Reminder will respond with day of week your bin goes out. Backwards compatible with existing users state. If you want to add day of week, reset and start the setup again.
-Introduced SSML Speechcons, which are special words and phrases that are pronounced more expressively by Alexa.
-Improved error handling

Update 1.2:
-Added in weekly as frequency choice
-Fixed issue with week day choice not interpreted correctly
-Added in sample video clip to demo setup. See above

Update 2.0:
-Handle multiple bin types. Bin reminder now allows you to setup multiple bin types.
It will now tell you (if applicable) what bins already went out this week and what bins are due out

Update 2.1:
-Add in frequency of four weeks
-New bin types

Update 2.2:
-Tell you if bins also go out next week

There are no external dependencies for Watch Dog users, so simply download the Skill and begin!
review:
Since launch I've been dependant on Amazon's US_FIRST_NAME list for understanding names, but the responses I get back from that don't make sense most of the time ("and is" when I say "Ethan" for example), and I've brought it up to Amazon multiple times with no reply.

Unfortunately to support names I have to rely on this service, so while it's being inaccurate the app will (sadly) remain inconsistent.

name: Love You Languages
description:
This skill tells you what the phrase "I love you" is in different languages. It is very easy to use, you just tell the skill I love you and it will read back the translation in a different language and tell you what language it chose. 

It is worth noting that Alexa pronounces things in American so the pronunciation will be a bit off which is a funny and cute quirk.

name: CoinFlip
description: Flips a coin and says either heads or tails, both options with equal probability. When you're not quite sure how to proceed and need a second and impartial opinion, ask Alexa.

name: DNS Tools
description: You can use DNS Tools to convert between IP addresses and domain names by saying give me the IP for domain. Some examples are give me the i. p. for google dot com and give me the domain for eight dot eight dot eight dot eight.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Alexa tells me that if I don’t hear it she can’t connect or it’s on silent.

name: IP Lookup
description: This looks up the location of a given ip4 address. Make sure to spell out the IP address with four numbers separated by the word 'dot.' - So you might ask for "four dot four dot four dot four."
review:
Great concept but needs work. I asked about 2 IP's and was told they are in the US.
5 stars if it could be more specific. (City & State)

skills-rest: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
name: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
description:
UPDATED for English-Canada as of January 26th, 2018! This skill was originally developed for English-US before Alexa was available in Canada and it had problems for people that were using English-Canada as their language.  It now works for everyone. Huzah!

You can use the City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule to find out the date of your next pickup. Sometimes holidays will change the date of the pickup, or perhaps you just don't remember if you have to take out garbage or recycling this week. Now you can just ask Alexa to find out when you need to take out the garbage.

Please make sure to prefix your question with "Alexa ask Ottawa Garbage". You can also say "Alexa, open Ottawa Garbage" and the app will ask you if you want to know the next pick up date.  You can't just say "Alexa, when is garbage day". I wish all skills worked like that but they don't. For many skills including this one, you need to address them by name.

If you're address isn't recognized, hit me up on twitter @stevemulligan or email steve@nonlocal.ca and I will do my best to get the skill working properly for you.
review: My husband asks me every week what day the garbage is. Now he can ask Alexa. A real sanity saver.

description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.

First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review:
First, it's not perfect. It's never ONCE offered to unload the dishwasher, for example. However, it does make my life simpler. I can control a set of devices with one command (request) so I don't have to micromanage my environment. I really don't have the patience to tell Alexa to turn this light on red at this percentage, and that light to white at this percentage (and so on) and also tell me the weather and my appointments for the day. It's annoying. I like my routines. I like to have everything just so and I like not having to worry that I forgot to set the house up for being away. I can just send Mosaic a message on Facebook and tell it "Goodbye". I can even see what the last request I made was by looking at my Facebook messages.

That said, the selection of workflows is still limited this early in the game but the developers are really responsive to input on what workflows would be cool to add. The upside is that you make the workflows what you want them to be. We needed to have a workflow to light up our back hallway and so on to full white brightness. The best workflow to choose was "House Party" because we are introverted hermits who would NEVER have a party. It's actually kind of amusing when we need to use it. (especially since Alexa usually tells us to make sure we have enough ice)

Having established workflows to call on makes it easier to avoid naming conventions that confuse Alexa's voice recognition.

All things considered, it's a really useful skill and we use the daylights out of it (unlike the Dog Facts skill).

Every morning, without fail, I ask Alexa to tell Mosaic "Good Morning". On comes my desk lamp, out goes the night light in the hall, living room lamp is set to a dim blue, laundry room light turns off (it's on at 50% at night for late snackers in the kitchen) and Alexa tells me my schedule and the daily forecast and current temperature. It's pretty awesome.

name: Blaze Bot
description: Blaze bot lets you know if it's time to blaze in CST. (4:20 am/pm)

name: Where's My Droid
description:
Use the original phone tracking app to find your phone. You can have Alexa make your phone ring on full volume or track it with the phones GPS.

Setup:
First you'll need to download the Where's My Droid app on your phone from Google Play. Run the app and setup a Commander account. You'll then log into that Commander account through the Alexa app to link your account.
review: Asked Alexa where my droid was. She gave me the location then asked me if I wanted to make the phone ring. It rang. I am happy!

name: Park Creek Activities
description: Stay connected and in touch with local community events at Park Creek! With just a simple ask of Alexa, she will be able to tell you all of our daily activities and much more! Need to hear it more than once? It's okay, just ask Alexa again, she doesn't mind!

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: I wish there was a way to block skills. Alexa keeps trying to install this skill everytime I mention something that contains calculator. Using a common word as a skill name should be bannable.

name: ZipCode

ZipCode Skill provides city and state of a zipcode. You can say the zipcode and the skill will tell you which city and state is that zipcode.
It will give the city and state info for any U.S. city.

name: Trash and Recycling Info
description:
This targeted skill provides info about waste management services for residents of Lynn, Massachusetts. You can ask whether your recycling bin will be picked up during the current week or the following week. 
Here are some additional planned features:
- Holiday and special service info.
- Address-specific info, including precise pickup dates for trash and recycling.
- Saved preferences to reduce the amount of info you have to give Alexa in each session.
- Support for other municipalities/regions.

name: Counter Girl

review: You might not think it, but this little thing is actually rather useful, especially with getting the timings right and whatnot haven't had any issues with it thus far!

name: Zip Code Lookup

name: Bugle Call Alarm
description:
Kick-start your day with this super loud alarm of a military bugle call (Reveille). Perfect as a 'wake-up' alert for yourself.

LOUD ALARMS
Beeping? Huh! Forget that. These are 1 minute ridiculously loud alarms, designed to wake you up fast.

ROUTINE NOTE
Soon you will be able to add this Alexa Skill to your Routines. Until then, you must activate it manually when you wake up. We will let everyone know when you can add this skill as a routine!

REVIEWS
iHearFun wants you to have fun, with our mega fun & useful skills! But we really need your support to keep this skill free, so if you have a few minutes please leave a 5-star review. Thank you.

CREDITS
This sound is Public Domain from Wikipedia. 'Reveille', performed by Sergeant Codie Lynn Williams of Dallas (ceremonial bugler for Marine Barracks Washington).
review: plays the bugle like you hear on Mash. Could be fun way to wake up sleepy heads!

skills-rest: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
name: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
description:
UPDATED for English-Canada as of January 26th, 2018! This skill was originally developed for English-US before Alexa was available in Canada and it had problems for people that were using English-Canada as their language.  It now works for everyone. Huzah!

You can use the City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule to find out the date of your next pickup. Sometimes holidays will change the date of the pickup, or perhaps you just don't remember if you have to take out garbage or recycling this week. Now you can just ask Alexa to find out when you need to take out the garbage.

Please make sure to prefix your question with "Alexa ask Ottawa Garbage". You can also say "Alexa, open Ottawa Garbage" and the app will ask you if you want to know the next pick up date.  You can't just say "Alexa, when is garbage day". I wish all skills worked like that but they don't. For many skills including this one, you need to address them by name.

If you're address isn't recognized, hit me up on twitter @stevemulligan or email steve@nonlocal.ca and I will do my best to get the skill working properly for you.
comment heading: Does not work on Canadian devices
review: Looks like a skill that should work on my device in Ottawa, but it is on amazon.com and not Amazon.ca, hence I can’t get it. Shame because it looks useful. Developer, please put it on amazon.ca too.

Example :

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review:
You must say: add to my list (shop for or do something or whatever you want)
Just ad to list doesn't work.  The key word seems to by my.
Example:  Alexa:  what do you want to do?  ans.  add to my list wash car.
If you say add wash car to my list it won't work.  It should but it doesn't.
The best thing about this app is being able to delete it verbally.

name: Safe Place
description:
Ever forgotten the safe place you put your passport last year? Now you can get Alexa to remember for you!

Safe Place remembers where you put those important things for you, simply tell Safe Place "my passport is in the safe" or "remember that my certificate is in the desk drawer".
When you come to need it next simply ask Safe Place "where's my passport?"

Want to update the location of an item?  Simply tell Safe Space the new location the same way you told it where it was before. 

To get Safe Space to forget an item's location just tell Safe Place "Forget my passport" or if you want it to forget everything, "forget me".

I hope you find Safe Place useful, thanks for checking it out!
review: I don't know how to make a change or make a correction.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: So far thus works and no annoying ad. Must change default sound from horrible alarm to something more pleasant.

name: Practice Logger
description:
PracticeLogger is a simple skill that allows you to keep track of how often you practice your musical instrument.  This can also be applied to anything that you want to monitor how often you do.  No one will judge your habits!

This skill offers the following features:
- Listen to daily, weekly, monthly and yearly statistics.
- Add a number of minutes to a day.
- Request the number of minutes from a specific day.
- Remove a number of minutes from a day.
- Remove all time from a day.
- Reset all so that you can start over again.
comment heading: Great idea - but lots of improvements needed to make ...
review: Great idea - but lots of improvements needed to make it a super-skill! For example, it would be great to sit down to a practice session and tell alexa to start a timer - and when you complete your practice - tell Alexa your practice session has ended. Also it would be nice to ask Alexa to email you a graphical summary of your practice times,,, etc -- lots of possibilities to make it a First-Class skill... If you need help, make it an open-source skill and we'll all jump in and help!

name: MyStopwatch
description:
A stopwatch app for Echo devices that has Start, Pause, Resume, Current Time, and Stop.


To start: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to start.'
To pause: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to pause.'
To resume: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to resume.'
To get the current time: 'Alexa, ask my stopwatch for the current time.'
To stop: 'Alexa, tell my stopwatch to stop.'
To get help: 'Alexa, ask my stopwatch for help.'

After each command (except for starting), Alexa will inform you of the current time of your stopwatch.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: Launching Stopwatch will start a timer just fine. However
review: Launching Stopwatch will start a timer just fine. However, it will not turn off. I tried "Alexa, cancel Stopwatch", "Alexa, stop Stopwatch", "Alexa, cancel all timers", but it would not stop the single allowed timer. I finally disallowed the skill at 24 days and counting. Surely there must be a better timer that counts upward.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.
