name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Works like a charm!!!

By going through the prompts, you can quickly and easily get approximate translations that can be used immediately. name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)

name: SCUBA Dive Planner
description: The Dive Planner skill gives Alexa the ability to compute custom decompression profiles for SCUBA diving.  This skill follows the philosophy that there is no such thing as a “no decompression dive”. No matter how shallow the depth or short the bottom time, by diving you will incur the poorly understood consequences of breathing mixed gasses at an atmospheric pressure well beyond our normal operating range. Care should be taken to carefully control the ascent rate and follow a decompression stop protocol for all dives, even those within recreational no-stop limits, to minimize the stresses on our bodies.
review: Dive planner does not provide a dive plan to 100 ft for 30 minutes.  Lousy software.

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: Great little skill. i know it just tells you the time but still. In fact i put this on my folks echo as well, and my mother laughs every time!!

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com
review: please allow for dings to go off while music apps, such as Spotify, can still play. Thanks! Will keep the app in hopes for improvement in the future!

name: Phone Tracker
description: If you often misplace your cell phone, then Phone Tracker is for you. Phone Tracker will call your cell phone so that you can follow the ringing sound to locate your phone. Phone Tracker's telephone number is 916-304-9601, so make sure you save it to your Contacts.
review: i dont understand why you have to tell Alexa your phone # each time and it isnt stored but a great app anyway vzp

name: Stopwatch
description:
A simple stopwatch for keeping track of the duration of various activities. The timer starts as soon as your request is made; no need to wait for a response from Alexa.

For quickest access, say:
"Alexa, ask stop watch start"
"Alexa, ask stop watch time"
"Alexa, ask stop watch stop"

name: Morning Rooster
description:
Wake up to the sound of the countryside with a rooster ! 

Simply say "Alexa, start morning rooster" to wake your family. 

To stop the rooster, you have to say "Alexa, stop". 

NOTE: Contrary to some reviews and comments, this Skill *absolutely* stops when you say "Alexa, stop".   But you do have to say 'Alexa' first - this is due to the way that Amazon has implemented the audio player.
review: Needs ability to schedule.  What is the point of having an "alarm" which must be manually activated each morning?  The only good point is that it is sufficiently LOUD.  I remove hearing aids at night and all of the Echo alarm sounds are to quiet to wake me up.  I can adjust for this by turning the volume all up, but that makes all other features too loud.  A valuable alternative is for Echo to add a volume adjustment within the alarm function.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: Doesn't link

name: Bin Collection
description:
I never know which bin is going to be collected this week. Living in Central Bedfordshire with a bi-weekly collection for regular trash or recycling can be tough.

Just ask this skill which is the colour for this week and it will tell you
comment heading: Wish I could modify for my area!
review: This is a great idea, but I wish we could modify the colors and days of the week!

name: Where's My Droid
description:
Use the original phone tracking app to find your phone. You can have Alexa make your phone ring on full volume or track it with the phones GPS.

Setup:
First you'll need to download the Where's My Droid app on your phone from Google Play. Run the app and setup a Commander account. You'll then log into that Commander account through the Alexa app to link your account.
review: It's garbage just like the app...never works

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
review:
To ask for the password you must be very specific with the question but anyone normally asking a question would say it other ways.  Like, Alexa (pause....) what is the wifi password, or what is my wifi password.
Developers... how about use your apps and figure out how Americans talk before rushing to push crap out that works. It no one will remember how to ask the question.

name: Retirement Countdown
description: Tech-savvy members of the workforce may not have a whiteboard with the number of days left, but they are probably curious enough about when their last day of work is coming up. Retirement Countdown is an Amazon Alexa skill built to help these soon-to-be-retirees know simply by asking. Retirement Countdown will record the last day of work and then give the time left until freedom.
comment heading: Best countdown I've found for Alexa!
review: 800 days to go! Love this app!

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: No need to even install this app. Just say, "Alexa, how long ago was [substitute date here]" and she'll tell you how long ago it was to the day.

name: Where's My Droid
description:
Use the original phone tracking app to find your phone. You can have Alexa make your phone ring on full volume or track it with the phones GPS.

Setup:
First you'll need to download the Where's My Droid app on your phone from Google Play. Run the app and setup a Commander account. You'll then log into that Commander account through the Alexa app to link your account.
review: Need to be able to ring phones by name. It will only make my phone ring even when I specify a different phone.

name: Bin reminder
description:
*NEW* Version Update 2.2! (See below)
**Now supports multiple bin types. Currently supports recycling,
black, general, green, brown, blue, pink,
white,grey,red,yellow,orange, glass and garden**

**Request a new bin type by sending email to alexaozcalendar@gmail.com**


Let Bin Reminder  know what frequency your bins go out and also do they start this week or next.

To get started, you simply need to say 'Open Bin Reminder,' and you will be guided through the flow.
Once the initial setup is configured, it will be stored for future reference.

If you move house or your bin frequency changes, no problem! You can reset and start again by saying "Alexa, ask Bin Reminder to reset".

The skill supports ISO week of the year. That means, weeks start with Monday.

To view a quick demo, check out link below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kB2EBVTSPkQ


**Feedback**:

You can email me directly at alexaozcalendar@gmail.com
 with any questions, comments or concerns.

Future releases will offer additional features based on community feedback.


Update 1.1:
-Added in day of the week as part of the initial setup. If applicable, Bin Reminder will respond with day of week your bin goes out. Backwards compatible with existing users state. If you want to add day of week, reset and start the setup again.
-Introduced SSML Speechcons, which are special words and phrases that are pronounced more expressively by Alexa.
-Improved error handling

Update 1.2:
-Added in weekly as frequency choice
-Fixed issue with week day choice not interpreted correctly
-Added in sample video clip to demo setup. See above

Update 2.0:
-Handle multiple bin types. Bin reminder now allows you to setup multiple bin types.
It will now tell you (if applicable) what bins already went out this week and what bins are due out

Update 2.1:
-Add in frequency of four weeks
-New bin types

Update 2.2:
-Tell you if bins also go out next week
review: It had been working flawlessly but when I say "Alexa, ask Bin Reminder is this my week" there is no recognition of the command and Alexa appears to be searching the Reminder & Alarms function.  Simple and effective has become flawed and useless. How do you do that?

name: Domain Name Info
description:
Currently Domain Name Info is able to locate the following four DNS records:
A Record (IPv4 address)
AAAA Record (IPv6 address)
MX Record (Mail Exchange)
TXT Record (Text)

Simply start by saying "Alexa, launch Domain Name Info" and Alexa will guide you through the rest.
review: Thanks for this wonderful app!

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)
comment heading: Does not work very well... and is not accurate. Double check your work
review:
I was really hoping this would work as it would be a really useful tool on my work bench. The problem is that of the 5 resistors I tested, it only got one right.  For example, I asked it for tell me the value of a Red Red Black Brown Brown and it told me 22 Ohms.. it should be 2.2k Ohms.  I then asked it to tell me the value of Red Red Black Yellow Brown which is 2.2Meg  and it told me 22 OHMS.  Based on this I cannot trust the skill... sorry

UPDATE:  turns on this SKILL only works for 3 band resistors... not very useful with modern day resistors.

name: Mr. Butler
description: Forget where you put your car keys? Your sunglasses? The flour? Butler is an easy-to-use item location reminder. Simply tell Butler where you put an item and Butler will remember next time you ask!
review: the reviews are terrible for this, but you do have to say it correctly.  it is most useful when you are putting things in places you usually don't.  it is house wide, so you can ask in the bedroom about the thing you left in the kitchen

name: Random Number Generator
description: This skill will generate a random number between 1-10. The skill is intended for entertainment purposes only, and is easy to use. Simply ask Alexa for a random number 1-10, and she will deliver one to you.

name: Interval Notice
description: This is a custom timer that will notify you after a given interval of time for as many times as you like. The number of repetitions and the amount of time between each notification is up to you. The only limit is that the total amount of time has to be less than one hour.
review: I had hoped to use this Alexa skill to prompt me to change yoga poses every 30 seconds.  It works well, but unfortunately stops after about 5 minutes.  The description says it will perform any number of intervals for up to an hour.  I would like a response from the developer to advise whether it is possible for it to perform this command: “set interval notice for 30 seconds 24 times”.

name: ZipCode
description:
ZipCode Skill provides city and state of a zipcode. You can say the zipcode and the skill will tell you which city and state is that zipcode.
It will give the city and state info for any U.S. city.
review: Nice and very useful

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
comment heading: Does what it should, No fancy sentences needed.
review: They must have updated the app because you only need to ask Alexa "is recycling this week" or "when is recycling?". It nice because I can barely remember yesterday let alone last week.

name: Router Reset Wizard
description: This skill helps you properly reset your router using the 30/30/30 maneuver. By counting for you, you can focus on the most important skill: Pushing the reset button :)
review: Your forgetting Alexa needs WiFi to do anything and if your reseting your router chances are your WiFi’s down

review: I enjoy adding to my shopping list via Alexa.  Can do it while thinking about it instead of hunting for my phone.

name: Someone Surprised
description: Have Alexa repeat your phrase after a delay of your choosing by saying: "Alexa, tell/ask Someone Surprised [say your phrase] in/after [say any delay in minutes or seconds less than 11 minutes]" . For example: "Alexa, tell Someone Surprised 'good morning, welcome to the kitchen' in 55 seconds." Or, another example: "Alexa, ask Someone Surprised after 10 minutes 'are you just going to sit there all morning?" Try to predict when someone will be within earshot and leave a surprising message for them.
comment heading: Actually the best skill on skill store, 10/10
review:
Have Alexa say anything you want whenever you want? It's the dream.

I feel like this is the beginning of "Alexa pranks," and I cant wait to see what other uses people can think up for this skill.

skills-rest: Countdown Clock - Christmas, New Year, and more
name: Countdown Clock - Christmas, New Year, and more
description:
Countdown Clock is a skill to help you count down to all major events around the year, including Christmas, New Year, Brexit, Easter, and more.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Supported events are:
Christmas Day
Christmas Eve
New Years Day
New Years Eve
Easter Sunday
Halloween
Brexit
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You can say:

"Alexa, open Countdown Clock"

"Alexa, start Countdown Clock"

review: it works as advertised. but, I wish I could just say “Alexa whats the Wi-Fi password” to have her speak the info.

name: Day of the year skill
description: Ask alexa and she will tell you current day of the year.
review: Alexa can already do this by asking "What is today's day of year?" Enabling this skill doesn't make the question any shorter.

name: Stop Smoking Now
description:
Stop Smoking Now is a skill to help you overcome your smoking habit with something you are super passionate about. Listen to this 22 minute relaxing meditation whenever needed. It will help you leave the cigarettes behind! 

You can say:

"Alexa, open Stop Smoking Now"
"Alexa, start Stop Smoking Now"
"Alexa, launch Stop Smoking Now"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at alexaskillfeedback@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!!
review: This guided meditation skill is very effective at relieving stress and getting my thoughts turned toward replacing smoking with a better, more productive activity.

description: This skill is perfect for people that want to have a New Year's Eve countdown, or just want to hear a fun, ecstatic countdown from 10. This plays a group of people counting down, perfect for any event where you need to count down.
review:
This starts a (random) 10 second countdown when you begin the skill.
If you knew when it is exactly 10 seconds before midnight,
why would you need this?

comment heading: No free clock list, timing is 90 seconds late.
review:
Ask for list of clocks. List includes Premium Clocks. Select list of Traditional Clocks instead. Select third option--Big Ben. Big Ben, I am told, is a premium clock. Give us a list of free clocks!
And it's not even telling the correct time! It runs a minute or so late! Jeeze Louise!

name: Princeton Calendar
description: This skill tells you all academic events and deadlines on a given date for Princeton University starting from September 9th, 2015. Simply ask for events on a date or a period of time such as this month or year.
review: You must know which days have a scheduled event in order to find a scheduled event

name: Aether Air Quality Reporter
description:
Retrieves the current air quality of most major U.S. cities.  To use aether, try saying....

Alexa, Ask Aether about Minneapolis.

Retrieves the current air quality index (AQI) of pm 2.5 from www.airnowapi.org.
review: Could not get data for any cities near me. Disappointing.

name: Safe Zone
description: This skill enables Alexa to provide the Safety Rating of a city.This skill can be used by travelers visiting a new city or planning to visit a new city.It can be used by parents to determine if their children are in a safe city.
comment heading: App does not work very well
review: No matter what city I asked for it's safety Alexa would say she isn't sure. Alexa does not seem to have a data base of cities for this app. App needs to be upgraded or tested more for accuracy.

name: UTC time
description: A simple skill which will return the date time in UTC
comment heading: Gives time in AM/PM which is the same way Alexa ...
review: Gives time in AM/PM which is the same way Alexa gives the time if you ask for the time in UTC. Wish it gave the proper Date/Time format.

review: I now talk to alex to do mostly everything.  I need a skill to order my medicine online. from publix.

name: Remember Your Keys
description: Have Alexa help you figure out if you remembered to do everything you need to do before you leave the house. Did you remember your keys? How about your wallet? And did you turn the oven off so your house won't be filled with smoke when you come back?
comment heading: I keep frequently forget my phone when I leave the ...
review: I  frequently forget my phone when I leave the house. I don't understand how  is this app going to help me if I forget to ask Alexa to  to tell me if I have everything I need. A more  helpful app  for a forgetful person such as myself would allow me to preprogram  Alexa to ask me,  in a soft voice, at  a set time in the morning, " Before you leave, check that you you have everything  you need". Or I could stick a poster  on my exit door  that reads, in big, bold, red letters "Check for  your phone you doofus".

name: Delay Say
description: Have Alexa repeat your phrase after a delay of your choosing by saying: "Alexa, tell/ask Delay Say to say [your phrase] in/after [any delay in minutes or seconds less than 11 minutes]" . For example: "Alexa, tell Delay Say to say 'Don't forget to turn off the rice' in 10 minutes." Or, another example: "Alexa, ask Delay Say to say 'welcome home mom' after 55 seconds".
review: This can be a great skill with some improvements.  it needs to be a little more advanced.  Would be good if you could have Alexa say the message in another room.

name: Morning Rooster
description:
Wake up to the sound of the countryside with a rooster ! 

Simply say "Alexa, start morning rooster" to wake your family.

NOTE: Contrary to some reviews and comments, this Skill *absolutely* stops when you say "Alexa, stop".   But you do have to say 'Alexa' first - this is due to the way that Amazon has implemented the audio player.
review: We had six roosters at one time and this is exactly how they sounded.  Each trying to outdo the other.  Very funny and by the way;  the roosters all got sent to the freezer!

name: Area Calculator
description:
This skill can provide the area formulas of basic shapes as well as calculate the area of basic shapes when given specific dimensions.

Somethings you can ask include:
what is the area of a square
what is the area of a trapezoid
what is the area of a parallelogram
what is the area of a triangle with base five and height six
what is the area of a trapezoid with bases three and two and height five
what is the area of a circle with radius twenty
what is the area of a square with side length four
what is the area of a parallelogram with base nine and height three

Future Updates:
Support decimal values for dimensions
Support more shapes

Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

review: useful

name: Holiday Timer
description:
This skill tells you how many days there are to your vacation or what date it is on. 
It allows you to create and delete vacations, as well as list them. Vacations will automatically be deleted after they have passed.

To create a vacation say "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation"

To delete a vacation say "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation".

To ask how many days until your vacation say "Ask holiday timer how many days to {destination}" or simply "Ask holiday timer {destination}".

To ask when a vacation is say "Ask holiday timer what date my {destination} vacation is" or "Ask holiday timer when is my vacation to {destination}"

To list your currently stored vacations say "Ask holiday timer to list my vacations"

The word holiday can be used instead of vacation for our European users :-)

The only data stored in the system is the vacation date and name, all vacations will be deleted after they have passed.
review: You only have the choice of "this year or next year" when setting a date. How about 2020? Thought we solved calender issues with Y2K? Please update the skill.

name: Work Clock
description:
This is a perfect skill to help keep track of your time without the hassle of manually clocking-in or out while you are working. A great tool for freelancers, consultants, or anything that requires you to keep track of your time.

Just open work clock, create a project with any name, and from there you can clock in and out of the project. If you need to record your clocked times, just ask for an email with the report, and Alexa will send it to your email!

NOTE: You need to enable account linking in order to email yourself a summary of your project times.

Below is a list of common commands:

"Create new project"
"Hear existing projects"
"Clock into 'project name'"
"Clock out of 'project name'"
"Tell me the total time of 'project name'"
"Email me a summary of all projects"
"Delete 'project name'"
"Hear all commands"

You can also easily clock-in and clock-out in one utterance:
"Alexa open work clock and clock in/out of 'project name'"

You can watch a live demo on our YouTube video here:
https://youtu.be/IMmJnrcZRhY

Any comments, questions, or suggestions? We would love to hear your feedback! Please contact us at our email - contact.xtechc@gmail.com
comment heading: Really a pain in the neck
review:
I love the concept, but some thiings need to be reworked. For instance, I started a project called “House Cleaning”.  The next time I clocked in, she didnt clock me in there, she made a brand new project called ‘house Queening”.  I tried for 40 minuts to clock out of that one, but couldnt figure out what was wrong. Then, next, she made yet a third project, called “Ahouse Cleaning”. same problem.  “Maddox Cleans”. Became “Maddox Queens”  “Mattix Spleens”, and now the latest disaster we can not even get it to clock out of.  I now have 12 projects, and i only needed 4, I can not get her to understand and delete them.

I wish there was a way to maybe initially TYPE the project name, and also a way to say “Clock out of everything”, so when it gets like that, there is a foolproof way to just clock out when she will not cooperate. Also wish there was a way to say “Add 30 minutes to House Cleaning”, for when i forgot to clock in.

review:
Much better way to manage lists than the Alexa app. The Alexa app can be slow and takes multiple steps to get to the lists. Reminders are supposed to be as simple and quick as possible or you won’t use them.

I do wish that AnyDo would allow me to rename my Alexa lists so that I can have one todo list instead of an “Alexa Todo”. The Alexa prefix annoys me for some reason. Or the ability to have multiple AnyDo lists to funnel into one Alexa todo list.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

name: Assist Reminder
description:
Assist Reminder will help you remember where you have put any of your items. You can do this by telling Alexa to remember where you have put certain things. Then you can tell Alexa to remind you where you have put these things. For example, you could say, "Alexa, tell Assist Reminder I put my wallet on desk ". After which you can say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder where is my wallet" and Alexa will tell you your wallet is on your desk. This is helpful for when you can not find your things, such as your badge, laptop, headphones, etc.
To get a list of all your reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to list all".
If you don't need the reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to clear".

name: Billy the Random Number Goat
description: Billy the Random Number Goat will provide you with a random number. If you ask Billy Goat for a random number or ask "What is my random number?", Billy Goat will return a random number between one and one hundred. You can also ask Billy Goat for a random number between a specific range. Simply ask Billy Goat to give you a number between one and ten or five and thirty. It's that simple!

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
review:
Stop watch keeps running
Does not respond to delete or stop stop watch??????

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: Doesn't respond to "how old is" or "how long ago" queries.

name: tips calculator
description:
Having trouble calculating tips when you get you bill? No worry, tips calculator is here to help you. (If you carry Alexa with you, kappa)

Just tell tips calculator how much you paid for you meal and how much percent tips you would like to pay. Tips calculator will do all the maths for you. Easy and accurate.
review: See title

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: Does not work at all, tried half dozen times. Too bad

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: what else can be said

review: So, they fixed the app in regards to Hue. The Hue servers were having difficulty connecting to Mosaic's servers but it's working perfectly now. I like that with a single command I can turn on my lights, get informed about the weather, get a traffic update, and get updates about my car. Waiting for Amazon to open up streaming to developers so Mosaic can play music but overall, a perfect skill in my book.

name: L. Cars
description:
L. Cars will boot up, tell you the current stardate in the style of Star Trek: TNG, and automatically close if there is no response from the user. A new feature added is decimal time. Ask "What time is it" and L. Cars will tell you the current decimal time. (Stardates and decimal time are approximate and based on UTC-05:00, "Eastern Time," they are also fictional and should not be used for actual time keeping). In both the television shows and movies set in the Star Trek Universe, the fictional "stardate" system of time keeping set the shows in a far off future. This skill will let you know the current stardate according to a proprietary calculation method unique to this skill. For more information on the system used to devise the current stardate, please visit https://jhelman857.wixsite.com/home/stardate . For more information on decimal time please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_time .

You can say:

"Alexa, open L. Cars"
"Alexa, start L. Cars"
"Alexa, launch L. Cars"
"Alexa, ask L. Cars what the time is"
"Alexa, ask L. Cars what the date is"

"What is the Stardate"
"What is the Decimal Time?"
"Exit Program"

Upon invoking the skill it will run automatically and give you the current stardate. You can end the program by saying "Stop," or it will end automatically after approximately two minutes.

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or, if you aren't happy with the unique style of calculating the current stardate please be patient as we add alternatives.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: Big help when I'm doing homework and I need a quick answer to a calculation

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.
comment heading: Works Great on my Straight Talk Phone!
review: Once enabled it helps me keep track if my data usage and refill date through Alexa!  Very cool!

name: SCUBA Dive Planner
description: The Dive Planner skill gives Alexa the ability to compute custom decompression profiles for SCUBA diving.  This skill follows the philosophy that there is no such thing as a “no decompression dive”. No matter how shallow the depth or short the bottom time, by diving you will incur the poorly understood consequences of breathing mixed gasses at an atmospheric pressure well beyond our normal operating range. Care should be taken to carefully control the ascent rate and follow a decompression stop protocol for all dives, even those within recreational no-stop limits, to minimize the stresses on our bodies.
comment heading: Aquavelva boy needs to learn dive tables
review: Maybe you should have paid attention when you we're learning to dive. Don't blame it on poor software. Blame it on the idiot using it. Yourself

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: Whisper mode on, time zone set. Have asked for the time 10 times no horror quote.

name: Baby Shush
description:
If your lips are falling off from the amount of soothing shushing you've been doing then Baby Shush is THE skill for you. Baby Shush uses a thoroughly tested technique designed to break a baby's cry spell and engage their natural calming reflex.

The rhythmic shush reminds baby of being inside mom, where they were inundated 24 hours a day with loud sounds of blood flow and other in utero noises (up to 95 dBs, or the sound of a very loud vacuum cleaner). What may sound harsh at first is actually very calming to a baby.

It will play on loop so you don't have to worry about baby being suddenly woken up.

You can say:

"Alexa, open Baby Shush"
"Alexa, start Baby Shush"
"Alexa, launch Baby Shush"

Please leave a review if you love this skill so other moms and dads can enjoy some peace and quiet :)

name: Deep Sleep Sounds

We use a high quality 2 hour audio stream, not 2 min loops with pauses some other sound providers use.

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!

name: Mehul Arti
description:
Jay Sadguru Swami or the Swaminarayan Arti is the arti sung in all the Swaminarayan Sampraday mandirs. Arti is conducted by the singing of a special prayer and the playing of musical instruments. The piece was composed by Muktanand Swami on 5 November 1802.[1][2] During the aarti, a lighted ghee lamp with wicks is waved before murtis, representations of Swaminarayan and other deities.[3] Swaminarayan is believed to be physically manifest in the murti, and several arti ceremonies are performed throughout the day, allowing devotees to show their devotion. As the murti is not permanently on view for devotees, the arti is an important opportunity to gain blessings through darshan of a physical manifestation of Swaminarayan. In shikharbaddha mandirs, aarti is performed five times a day according to Vaishnava tradition, while In dev mandirs or Hari mandirs, arti is performed in the morning and evening only.[4] The BAPS version of the aarti is based on an original manuscript of Muktanand Swami’s works.[5]

You can say:

"Alexa, open Mehul Arti"
"Alexa, start Mehul Arti"
"Alexa, launch Mehul Arti"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at all.feedback@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: Nice skill development

name: Lunar Calendar
description:
This skill helps to provide the current day in the lunar calendar.

More info from Wikipedia:
A lunar calendar is a calendar based upon the monthly cycles of the Moon's phases (synodic months), in contrast to solar calendars, whose annual cycles are based only directly upon the solar year. 
...
Although the Gregorian calendar is in common and legal use in most countries, traditional lunar and lunisolar calendars continue to be used throughout the Old World to determine religious festivals and national holidays. Examples of such holidays include Ramadan (Islamic calendar); Easter, the Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Mongolian New Year (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Mongolian calendars); the Nepali New Year (Nepali calendar); the Mid-Autumn Festival and Chuseok (Chinese and Korean calendars); Loi Krathong (Thai calendar); Sunuwar calendar; Diwali (Hindu calendars); and Rosh Hashanah (Hebrew calendar).

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

name: SCUBA Dive Planner
description: The Dive Planner skill gives Alexa the ability to compute custom decompression profiles for SCUBA diving.  This skill follows the philosophy that there is no such thing as a “no decompression dive”. No matter how shallow the depth or short the bottom time, by diving you will incur the poorly understood consequences of breathing mixed gasses at an atmospheric pressure well beyond our normal operating range. Care should be taken to carefully control the ascent rate and follow a decompression stop protocol for all dives, even those within recreational no-stop limits, to minimize the stresses on our bodies.
review: There does not exist a no-deco dive to 100 feet for 30 minutes - the no decompression limit at 100 feet is 20 minutes.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: Never worked at all

name: Lunar Calendar
description:
This skill helps to provide the current day in the lunar calendar.

More info from Wikipedia:
A lunar calendar is a calendar based upon the monthly cycles of the Moon's phases (synodic months), in contrast to solar calendars, whose annual cycles are based only directly upon the solar year. 
...
Although the Gregorian calendar is in common and legal use in most countries, traditional lunar and lunisolar calendars continue to be used throughout the Old World to determine religious festivals and national holidays. Examples of such holidays include Ramadan (Islamic calendar); Easter, the Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Mongolian New Year (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Mongolian calendars); the Nepali New Year (Nepali calendar); the Mid-Autumn Festival and Chuseok (Chinese and Korean calendars); Loi Krathong (Thai calendar); Sunuwar calendar; Diwali (Hindu calendars); and Rosh Hashanah (Hebrew calendar).

name: Safe Place
description:
Ever forgotten the safe place you put your passport last year? Now you can get Alexa to remember for you!

Safe Place remembers where you put those important things for you, simply tell Safe Place "my passport is in the safe" or "remember that my certificate is in the desk drawer".
When you come to need it next simply ask Safe Place "where's my passport?"

Want to update the location of an item?  Simply tell Safe Space the new location the same way you told it where it was before. 

To get Safe Space to forget an item's location just tell Safe Place "Forget my passport" or if you want it to forget everything, "forget me".

I hope you find Safe Place useful, thanks for checking it out!

To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".

name: note me (beta)
description:
The skill is in beta mode and may have some bugs, you can report bugs and give recommendations for improving the skill. 

Note me allows you to save short notes and recall them whenever you ask Alexa to play the notes or messages back to you. You can save up to 5 messages or notes. You can also delete them by saying delete. 
** Automatically registers the user on enabling skill and deletes him/her from database if all notes deleted or skill is disabled.
 
Example : 
"Alexa launch note me"
" save I am going to the store tomorrow"

" play" Alexa will play the note back You in her voice 

"Delete" Alexa will delete the messages
"Delete first note" deletes the first note only

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
comment heading: I like it but would love it if it had more ...
review: I like it but would love it if it had more functionality and the ability to create your own work flows.  Also struggled with configuring workflows only to find out the issue was related to IE (should have known IE stinks)....  Used Chrome browser and then I could modify workflows without issue.  Love the concept but am anxiously waiting for more features.

name: Net10
description:
Use your Ask Net10 Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Net10 Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Net10 Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your NET10 Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a NET10 Wireless Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check net10wireless.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Net10 phone and service. Go to www.net10.com for more details.

name: Interval Notice
description: This is a custom timer that will notify you after a given interval of time for as many times as you like. The number of repetitions and the amount of time between each notification is up to you. The only limit is that the total amount of time has to be less than one hour.
comment heading: Would Be Perfect If One Thing was Changed
review:
Needed a skill to assist me in training for cycling different terrains. This skill comes closest to doing what I need. Wish the skill prompts Alexa to say something more useful (And motivating) then "Time" whenever the counter reaches the interval you set.

How about deducting the interval time from the total time remaining and telling Alexa to speak that information?

Example: You start a session.
<MyLady>, Ask IntervalNotice to set 5 minute timer 5 times (Total of timer 30 minutes.)

When the counter has elapsed 5 minutes Alexa will say "25 minutes remain." Elapses the second 5 minutes Alexa will say "20 minutes remain." Will behave this way, until it hits "5 minutes remain." At "0 minutes remain" Alexa will sound the default chime (Wish there was a way to change this chime.)

Is the above doable?

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
comment heading: Theory: Review Score x 25 = Reviewer’s IQ
review:
Name-calling? Really? THAT is your idea of how you review a Skill?
OK.
Ahem.
Clearly, these one-star reviews are the work of underachieving, sad, pathetic, poorly-educated, losers who truly believe that they “coulda/woulda/shoulda struck it rich like that Trump feller, if’n ‘tweren’t for all them gosh darn liberals lettin’ ferners and kullards take our jobs.”
So....
Can we get back to reviewing the skill itself?

skills-rest: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
name: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
description:
UPDATED for English-Canada as of January 26th, 2018! This skill was originally developed for English-US before Alexa was available in Canada and it had problems for people that were using English-Canada as their language.  It now works for everyone. Huzah!

You can use the City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule to find out the date of your next pickup. Sometimes holidays will change the date of the pickup, or perhaps you just don't remember if you have to take out garbage or recycling this week. Now you can just ask Alexa to find out when you need to take out the garbage.

Please make sure to prefix your question with "Alexa ask Ottawa Garbage". You can also say "Alexa, open Ottawa Garbage" and the app will ask you if you want to know the next pick up date.  You can't just say "Alexa, when is garbage day". I wish all skills worked like that but they don't. For many skills including this one, you need to address them by name.

If you're address isn't recognized, hit me up on twitter @stevemulligan or email steve@nonlocal.ca and I will do my best to get the skill working properly for you.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.

name: Translation Please
description:
Translation Please is a new skill that will translate sentences, phrases, and/or words from English to French, Spanish, Italian, and German. you can have your sentence translated to all four languages at the same time and 'people' from the appropriate country will say the translation(s) for you. You can also have Alexa translate into only one of the four languages. If you do, 'she' will remember your language of choice for future visits.

You can even start the skill up by saying:
"Alexa, ask Translation Please for Spanish, and 'she' will start in the Spanish translating mode. (This works with he other 3 languages as well). 

And, of course, you can open the skill by saying:

"Alexa, open Translation Please."
"Alexa, start Translation Please."
and
"Alexa, begin Translation Please."

Once you start, it's as simple as saying:
"translate, what day is it today"
or
"translate, it's about time you got here"
 
 Be sure to leave a review telling us what you think of it, and if you have any suggestions about improving it! e.g. more languages maybe?
review: Great skill helps me listen to French so I can learn the language better and more naturally

review: Not enough.  I was hoping for a daily contributions to a journal.  Maybe it's just me, but I don't like computers anticipating my taste.

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
comment heading: If you don't like it GTFO
review: MAGA 2020

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
review: See above - useless.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: No problems yet.

name: APRS
description: Locate APRS stations using the APSR Internet System, and reverse-geocode the locations to approximate addresses.
review: It provided the locations for various devices I use. I stated letters and number. Phonetic callsign use did not work.

review: I tried to like this app but it did not fulfill my needs. I think it has a lot of potential but I am just not disciplined enough to remember to put things in to remind me.

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: It only worked once. After that it either doesn't understand or just gives no response and stops litening. Do you guys even try these things before you publish them?

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: Too cumbersome to use. Commands are long & complex.

name: Interval Notice
description: This is a custom timer that will notify you after a given interval of time for as many times as you like. The number of repetitions and the amount of time between each notification is up to you. The only limit is that the total amount of time has to be less than one hour.
review: You can set an interval for a certain number of minutes, but saying “30 seconds” does not work.

description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
review: Cry a river! Trump 2020!

name: Random Number
description: A simple skill, Alexa will give you a random number between 1 and 100. Useful for settling the sibling squabble about who gets the last slice of cake.
comment heading: Alexa already does this on her own...
review: This doesn't work... AND Alexa comes with it standard.... "Alexa Random Number" "Alexa number between 1 and 10" "Alexa number between 1 and 100"

name: Currency Converter
description: Ask Alexa to convert money from your country to other country. She will look for the current exchange rate and tell you what is the amount of the money that your currency represents in other countries. You can ask her too about conversion from other currencies or exchange rate from several currencies all around the world.

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!
review: Too quiet to hear, and sounds like a harmonica.

name: Cruise Countdown
description: Add your cruises and let Alexa calculate the time until you set sail!
review: you can list upcoming cruises. the app asks for the date and time that the cruise departs. It then asks for the cruise destination, i.e.”Southern Caribbean.”. it will then tell you how many days and hours until the cruise departs. Don’t make a mistake when entering cruise information as there is no edit or delete option. I did make a mistake when entering one of our cruises and the only way to correct it was to disable the app which deleted all of the cruises and then re-enable the app and start over.

name: CloudClock
description: Tells the date time of US West, East, London, India and Japan
review: Too much information.

name: Celebrity Coffee Quotes
description:
Celebrity Coffee Quotes is a skill to help you _____________________.

You can say:

"Alexa, open Celebrity Coffee Quotes"
"Alexa, start Celebrity Coffee Quotes"
"Alexa, launch Celebrity Coffee Quotes"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills. Thanks!
