name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.

name: Holiday Timer
description:
This skill tells you how many days there are to your vacation or what date it is on. 
It allows you to create and delete vacations, as well as list them. Vacations will automatically be deleted after they have passed.

To create a vacation say "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation"

To delete a vacation say "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation".

To ask how many days until your vacation say "Ask holiday timer how many days to {destination}" or simply "Ask holiday timer {destination}".

To ask when a vacation is say "Ask holiday timer what date my {destination} vacation is" or "Ask holiday timer when is my vacation to {destination}"

To list your currently stored vacations say "Ask holiday timer to list my vacations"

The word holiday can be used instead of vacation for our European users :-)

The only data stored in the system is the vacation date and name, all vacations will be deleted after they have passed.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

review: Works great pretty good just wish the skill name was easier to pronounce

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: if you ask for the time in a whisper, you'll get the time whispered to you.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: Alexa will constantly try to set alarms or timers instead of using this skill. The suggested commands did not work except for specifically saying "ask stopwatch to ____". Even with that it seems most of the time I still get asked when the set an alarm for.

name: Galaxy's Edge Countdown - Star Wars Unofficial

name: Time Tone
description:
The first active timer for Alexa! Instead of simply beeping at a predetermined time, this skill provides second and 10 second interval updates! Has two modes! One that great for motivating short, 5 minute tasks The other mode is great for providing white background noise with a gentle reminder of time!

There are two modes: 
Mode 1). A 5 minute long timer. Uses beeps to indicate individual seconds and speech for 10 second intervals. Can end at any point, at which it returns the amount of time elapsed.

Mode 2). An hour long soothing timer. Uses a soothing tick-tock water noise to indicate seconds and periodic thunder for every 10 second interval. Can end at any point, at which it returns the amount of time elapsed.
Mode two format is as follows: 
tick tock tick tock tick tock tick tock tick thunder.

To use, there are a variety of ways to activate each timer. The general schema is:

To Begin:
Alexa, ask time tone to play.   This defaults to the first mode.
Alexa, ask time tone for first.   Plays the first mode.

Alexa, ask time tone for second.   Plays the second mode.
Alexa, ask time tone for rain.   Plays the second mode.


To end (Ends timer and returns elapsed time):
Alexa, ask time tone to end.     
Alexa, ask time tone finish.

Disclaimer: Timer accuracy is dependent on a variety of factors, including network latency and reliability. Not meant for mission-critical/time sensitive tasks.
review: It stinks. You use to be able to just ask Alexa to time 5 mins, etc. Now you have to open the time tone app and it still won’t time when asked.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com
review: Audible clock is a neat skill.

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.

name: Random Number 1 to 10
description: Ask for a random number. Returns a random number from 1 to 10.

name: Morning Rooster
description:
Wake up to the sound of the countryside with a rooster ! 

Simply say "Alexa, start morning rooster" to wake your family. 

To stop the rooster, you have to say "Alexa, stop". 

NOTE: Contrary to some reviews and comments, this Skill *absolutely* stops when you say "Alexa, stop".   But you do have to say 'Alexa' first - this is due to the way that Amazon has implemented the audio player.
review: Once started, it was impossible to stop this skill without disabling the skill and then unplugging my Echo.

name: Phone Number Check
description:
the skill provides basic information about a 10 digit phone number in the United State:
1. type of call: land line, mobile, etc (if available)
2. carrier: if available
3. location: if available

name: Microcontroller Assist
description:
When comes to selecting a perfect controller for your project there are numerous technical features to consider and also non technical issues such as cost, lifetime ,etc. Microcontroller Assist is here to help.

To get start, just say "Alexa, ask Microcontroller Assist".  Microcontroller Assist will step you thru a list of 10 steps to choose a perfect microcontroller for your next project.

Just say "next" or "continue" to go to the next step. 

You can 'bookmark' the current step by saying "save the step" so that you can continue at a later time.  To get back to the step where it was left off, just say "load the last step"
review: This is just a FAQ of the categories to analyze yourself in selecting a microcontroller.

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)
review: Nerdy but useful skill.  Saved me a lot of time.  I only have one question: Why is one of Resistor Decoder's reviewers complaining about Alexa replying "no problem" when you say "thank you" to the Echo?  That has nothing to do with this nerdy skill.

name: hey yinz
description:
Ever wanted to talk like a born and raised Pittsburgher? Well, this app can help you practice. It will translate any phrase you say into Pittsburghese. Note: a phrase might not have a distinct Pittsburghese translate so you might just hear the same phrase repeated back to you. 
 
 After the skill replies, you can also ask Alexa to repeat or slow down the last translation.

name: LunarDate
description: This skill is to convert the Gregorian date to Chinese Lunar date
review: It is useful for me. Thanks!

name: Memory Bank
description:
You are in the middle of making dinner, and are just about to add the cheese when the phone rings. You are on Step 5 of some instructions when the doorbell rings. You just remembered you need to call Dave back, when your spouse or child demands attention 'Right Now'.

Memory Bank comes to the rescue in these, and many other situations. Call on Memory Bank to remember whatever it was you were doing. Then, after handling the situation that interrupted you, ask Memory Bank to recall the memory. 

Memory Bank is meant to be fast and simple because you may only have a few seconds preserve the memory before devoting your entire attention to the interruption. As such, it can only remember one thing at a time for you. Asking Memory Bank to remember a second memory will overwrite the first, but you can record a memory with a single sentence.

For example: Alexa ask Memory Bank to remember that I need to mix in the chili powder, but I only want to use 1 tablespoon.
review: I wish it could remember more than one item and search that item when questioned.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.
review: It installed easily. I want to be able to see how many minutes I have left and how much data I have left in order to know whether or not to buy more.  When I ask Alexia "How many min do I have left?" (or any similar question) Alexia says "Thank you, good bye"

review: does not work, dont waist your time.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Simply Awesome.  Puts an end to everytime searching of my phone at home

name: Get Percentage
description: The "Get Percentage" Alexa Skill can be used to calculate discounts, taxes, tips or help you with homework as well. Just ask Alexa - What is result of twenty percent of one twenty and Alexa will calculate the difference between the original value and the percent to return the final result. Apart from that, you can also work with regular percentages by asking "thirty five percent of hundred thousand" to get the result. App icon designed by Flaticon.

name: Domain Name Info
description:
Currently Domain Name Info is able to locate the following four DNS records:
A Record (IPv4 address)
AAAA Record (IPv6 address)
MX Record (Mail Exchange)
TXT Record (Text)

Simply start by saying "Alexa, launch Domain Name Info" and Alexa will guide you through the rest.
review: Works OK if the domain has maybe 4-5 characters, and doesn't contain the letters p or b, and doesn't have a .me or other less common extension, and a lot of other caveats.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: It's really impressive to see how seamless the flow is, and I really like the capability to control multiple devices at the same time

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: Why do I want a timer popping up on firetv and interrupting whatever anyone might be watching?

name: Tweech for Twitter
description:
This skill reads your twitter timeline to you.
Tweech is your personalized flash briefing. You can easily stay up to date with updates that are are relevant for you.
Start your day hearing what the people you follow talk about and get news in real time as you expect it from twitter.

If you want to receive specific information just open a new twitter account and follow the relevant accounts. You can configure you own flash briefing in seconds.

Only english tweets are read. For a better experience the tweets are cleaned up.
After you have activated the skill you will be asked for a read-only access to your twitter account.

Feel free to send us feedback, bugs or feature request to twitter@futureofvoice.com

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: Great with decimals but fumbles sometimes with big numbers. Made my life so easy!

name: Location Reminder
description: This skill is designed to help you remember where you put your stuff. You can tell it where your stuff is and after you inevitably forget it, you can just ask Alexa. Unfortunately this is setup for a pretty strict input structure. For making an entry say something like "My/The/... stuff is/are in/at/under/... location", and for getting reminded the command structure is "where is/are my/the/... stuff". You can also delete entries. I hope this skill helps somebody.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
review: Why not just use start/pause/resume/stop/elapsed time? You know, commands that make sense?

name: Currency Converter
description: Ask Alexa to convert money from your country to other country. She will look for the current exchange rate and tell you what is the amount of the money that your currency represents in other countries. name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!

name: Net10
description:
Use your Ask Net10 Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Net10 Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Net10 Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your NET10 Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Net TEN to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a NET10 Wireless Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check net10wireless.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Net10 phone and service. Go to www.net10.com for more details.

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.

name: World Time

This skill helps customers get the current time in any city or country in the world. The user frames a question such as "Alexa, what's the time in New York?". The location is obtained from the user's utterance and

The co-ordinates are used to obtain the current time using the Google
Timezone API. The time is also adjusted for Daylight Saving wherever applicable.

name: Time Tone
description:
The first active timer for Alexa! Instead of simply beeping at a predetermined time, this skill provides second and 10 second interval updates! Has two modes! One that great for motivating short, 5 minute tasks The other mode is great for providing white background noise with a gentle reminder of time!

There are two modes: 
Mode 1). A 5 minute long timer. Uses beeps to indicate individual seconds and speech for 10 second intervals. Can end at any point, at which it returns the amount of time elapsed.

Mode 2). An hour long soothing timer. Uses a soothing tick-tock water noise to indicate seconds and periodic thunder for every 10 second interval. Can end at any point, at which it returns the amount of time elapsed.
Mode two format is as follows: 
tick tock tick tock tick tock tick tock tick thunder.

To use, there are a variety of ways to activate each timer. The general schema is:

To Begin:
Alexa, ask time tone to play.   This defaults to the first mode.
Alexa, ask time tone for first.   Plays the first mode.

Alexa, ask time tone for second.   Plays the second mode.
Alexa, ask time tone for rain.   Plays the second mode.


To end (Ends timer and returns elapsed time):
Alexa, ask time tone to end.     
Alexa, ask time tone finish.

Disclaimer: Timer accuracy is dependent on a variety of factors, including network latency and reliability. Not meant for mission-critical/time sensitive tasks.
review:
What would be nice: a longer timer that announces every 10 minutes. Even better, specific statements a various intervals.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Constantly 'losing' my phone. This.skill has saved me so much frustration.

name: remember this
description:

A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.

review: Won't work

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!

name: Bike Share
description:
NOTE: Bike Share only currently supports Citibike in New York City. Stay tuned for support for more bike share systems across the country!

Bike Share allows you to quickly find the closest bike share station to your address with bikes available! Use it on the way out of the house in the morning to avoid walking to an empty station. If a station has less than 3 bikes available, Bike Share will also let you know  the next station that is more populated. 

First, you need to add the address where your Amazon Echo resides. Start by saying:
"Add an Address."

Alexa will prompt you, step by step, to add your address, starting with your house number. For example, if your address was 350 5th Avenue, 10118, when prompted for your house number, you would say "three fifty".

Next, Bike Share will ask for your street name. Using the above example address, you would say "fifth avenue".

Finally, Bike Share will ask for your zip code. In the above example, you would answer, "one zero one one eight".

Once saved, you can then ask at any time to find the closest bike. Just say: "find me a bike."
Alexa will remember your address indefinitely, so you'll never need to add an address again unless you move your Echo. 

If you need to change your address, just tell Bike Share: "change my address". Alexa will ask if you want to overwrite your current address; if you respond "yes", you will be given the chance to enter a new address.

name: Ask Cloud Ninja
description: The Cloud Ninja skill is your guide to Amazon Web Services. name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

name: Bugle Call Alarm
description:
Kick-start your day with this super loud alarm of a military bugle call (Reveille). Perfect as a 'wake-up' alert for yourself.

LOUD ALARMS
Beeping? Huh! Forget that. These are 1 minute ridiculously loud alarms, designed to wake you up fast.

ROUTINE NOTE
Soon you will be able to add this Alexa Skill to your Routines. Until then, you must activate it manually when you wake up. We will let everyone know when you can add this skill as a routine!

REVIEWS
iHearFun wants you to have fun, with our mega fun & useful skills! But we really need your support to keep this skill free, so if you have a few minutes please leave a 5-star review. Thank you.

CREDITS
This sound is Public Domain from Wikipedia. 'Reveille', performed by Sergeant Codie Lynn Williams of Dallas (ceremonial bugler for Marine Barracks Washington).
review: Needs ability to schedule.  What is the point of having an "alarm" which must be manually activated each morning?  The only good point is that it is sufficiently LOUD.  I remove hearing aids at night and all of the Echo alarm sounds are to quiet to wake me up.  I can adjust for this by truning the volume all up, but that makes all other features too loud.  A valuable alternateive is for Echo to add a volume adjustment within the alarm function.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

review: Does what it says.  Syntax is found in the detailed skill description.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.

name: Holiday Timer
description:
This skill tells you how many days there are to your vacation or what date it is on. 
It allows you to create and delete vacations, as well as list them. Vacations will automatically be deleted after they have passed.

To create a vacation say "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation" or "Ask holiday timer to create a vacation"

To delete a vacation say "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation to {destination}" or "Ask holiday timer delete my vacation".

To ask how many days until your vacation say "Ask holiday timer how many days to {destination}" or simply "Ask holiday timer {destination}".

To ask when a vacation is say "Ask holiday timer what date my {destination} vacation is" or "Ask holiday timer when is my vacation to {destination}"

To list your currently stored vacations say "Ask holiday timer to list my vacations"

The word holiday can be used instead of vacation for our European users :-)

The only data stored in the system is the vacation date and name, all vacations will be deleted after they have passed.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

description: This skill is designed to help you remember where you put your stuff. You can tell it where your stuff is and after you inevitably forget it, you can just ask Alexa. Unfortunately this is setup for a pretty strict input structure. For making an entry say something like "My/The/... stuff is/are in/at/under/... location", and for getting reminded the command structure is "where is/are my/the/... stuff". You can also delete entries. I hope this skill helps somebody.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: Commands are not intuitive and I frequently trigger other Alexa functions by mistake just trying to get this skill to do basic things like reset the stopwatch. Only 3 commands are listed on the page  Disabled after 10 minutes - I'll stick with using a timer and doing some math in my head.

name: Game Score
description:
Whatever game you're playing, you can now keep score without using paper and pen! Adding and subtracting are so 20th century. Let Alexa do the score keeping for you!

To start, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score to start a new game."

You can add players by saying, "Alexa, tell Game Score that Susan is playing." You don't have to add players, however, you can simply add scores for players as the game progresses.

Say, "Alexa, tell Game Score to give 5 points to Robert."

Find out the score by saying, "Alexa, ask Game Score for the score."

If you just want to know who's in the lead, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score who's winning."

To find anyone's score, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score how many points Steve has."

For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
comment heading: Find My Phone is better & free!
review: I have used the other phone finder, FIND MY PHONE for a couple of years and it works great and it’s always FREE So when I saw your skill with about the same name having been updated three weeks ago…  It sounded like the app I was already using so I updated. I then got 5 messages on the activity log in my Alexa app saying I was about to be charged x—$/month. That ticks me off because I knew I had not requested a Premium subscription… And yet it kept popping up every few hours and I finally had to disable your skill in order to remove it. I feel a little misLead… The other guys were around first and they’re always free and you only mention android. You don’t even mention iOS ... anyway I think the way you describe everything is a little shady. Anyone looking for a really great free app that works wonderfully well, requires No fuss to link your number , Completely FREE I repeat… go to the skill called FIND MY PHONE by OPEARLO.com

description:

name: Assist Reminder
description:
Assist Reminder will help you remember where you have put any of your items. You can do this by telling Alexa to remember where you have put certain things. Then you can tell Alexa to remind you where you have put these things. For example, you could say, "Alexa, tell Assist Reminder I put my wallet on desk ". After which you can say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder where is my wallet" and Alexa will tell you your wallet is on your desk. This is helpful for when you can not find your things, such as your badge, laptop, headphones, etc.
To get a list of all your reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to list all".
If you don't need the reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to clear".

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)
review:
Don't appreciate the 'no problem' response when I say thank you to Alexa. This misuse of language is appalling and reflective of the minimal teaching and learning skills in our schools.
As president of a company which employs an office staff of sixty, I make it my business to make certain 'you're welcome' is the only acceptable response to our clients.
While no problem might not offend some, it is still not acceptable.  Indeed our hiring interview process attempts to illicit whether the applicant had the necesssry tools to fit into our organization.

description:

review: O and 0 are pronounced O and O instead of O and Zero, this makes it confusing if people have O and or 0 in their passwords.. Also, in conversation with a human would you say "Bob, tell wifi password." Most likely not, unless English is your second language maybe? In my opinion there should be a few phrases added so that anyone walking into my home can ask for the wifi password in the few different ways there are to ask someone for a wifi password. Good idea for a skill though, thank you.

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.
review: Refused to link after several attempts.  Finally linked, but tells me nothing about my balance...

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
comment heading: Have to read a book to get the reminder
review: Great idea, but I have to look at a screen shot of the reminder to know what to say. Why can't I just say "Alexa is recycling this week"

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
review: It just keeps saying ‘the list is empty’ and when you get around it by saying what you want to add, it keeps repeating your Number 1 but still does not recognize the phrase ‘add to list’

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
comment heading: Useless unless your volume is up
review: 'Fffgggg

name: Foundmi
description:
This skill lets you ring your foundmi tag if you're having trouble finding it and you are sure that it's lying somewhere around you because you can see that you're connected to it with the accompanying foundmi iOS/Android. You need to be logged into the accompanying foundmi app and have a valid foundmi tag paired with the app before expecting this feature to work. Also you need to use the foundmi hero name that you've used to pair up your tag. Typical foundmi tag hero names are  Superman, Batman, Spiderman, etc. There are around 24 of such foundmi tag flavors available in the foundmi store.

It also lets you find your phone by ringing it if you're signed in to the foundmi app.
review: Alexa doesn’t recognize the skill at all. All my other skills work fine. Am I saying “Foundmi” correctly? I have tried “found me” and “found my” but Alexa just can’t figure out what I am asking.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: Make flow by combing several actions save much of my time.... Upvote

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: Convenient! What more can you ask for...

name: FloatHub
description: With the FloatHub skill, you can easily ask, "Alexa, how's the boat?" Get a quick status update, check the pumps, and query the current ambient weather conditions.

name: Game Score
description:
Whatever game you're playing, you can now keep score without using paper and pen! Adding and subtracting are so 20th century. Let Alexa do the score keeping for you!

To start, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score to start a new game."

You can add players by saying, "Alexa, tell Game Score that Susan is playing." You don't have to add players, however, you can simply add scores for players as the game progresses.

Say, "Alexa, tell Game Score to give 5 points to Robert."

Find out the score by saying, "Alexa, ask Game Score for the score."

If you just want to know who's in the lead, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score who's winning."

To find anyone's score, say, "Alexa, ask Game Score how many points Steve has."
comment heading: Brings back the fun in playing games with the family!
review: I can't count the number of times I couldn't find pen/paper to keep score of our family game. This was a life saver! Easy to use!
