name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: Very handy and works great. Please read the 3 Simple commands to help you :)
review:
Great utility. Could not guess how to stop the watch however, when I moved myself to read the instruction on how to use it correctly, it worked just like it should!
Thank you for this Alexa App.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.
review: Useless.  Should not show up if you don't live in TEXAS.

name: Thunderstorm Sounds
description:
Ambient sounds from nature are proven to help boost your focus at work, sleep better at night, or just help improve your mindfulness altogether.

All you need to do is say Alexa start Best ThunderStorm Sounds, and she will play the track for 60 minutes. Saying Alexa loop on will keep her playing until you say stop. This is a perfect skill to leave on while you are asleep, to use for relaxation and meditation, or to tune in and focus on your work.

review: live sound of thunder and rain

name: Power Ball
description:
Ask Power Ball for a quick pick or for the latest winning numbers.
Disclaimer - this skill is for entertainment purposes only and may not be suitable for all ages.
comment heading: Negative Stars. No instructions or information!
review: I play and enjoy Amazon’s Jeopardy. After my last game, Alexa said, “Since you like Jeopardy, would you like to play Powerball?” This implies that Powerball is a game that is similar to Jeopardy. I enabled it, then it asked if I wanted a quick pic or something else. I said quick pic, and it gave me a series of numbers. Then silence. Is that it? Are these numbers supposed to be winning numbers? What’s the point of this game? In what way is it anything at all like Jeopardy? Why would Alexa suggest that since I like Jeopardy I might like Powerball? Especially for a game that bears no resemblance at all to Jeopardy? And now I wonder: By enabling this skill, did I somehow enable Amazon to charge my credit card to buy Powerball tickets? This is the last thing I would want to do!! There are other reviews that pose the very same question, but no information at all in the app about what the game is intended to do: what is its purpose? How does one play it? In what way does it resemble Jeopardy? This now seems like some kind of scam, and I am worried that my card may be charged without my intent. I wanted to play a question-and-answer game, and now I find myself writing a lengthy message to Amazon! OK, so I had a little bit of time to kill. That doesn’t mean that I wanted to engage in an extended conversation with customer service! This seems like a bait and switch, and I don’t like it at all.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

name: Birthday Countdown
description:
Tells you how many days until someone's birthday. Any number of birthdays can be tracked on a first name basis.

Example conversations:

"Alexa, open birthday countdown for Maria"
"There is one month and nine days until Maria's birthday"

"Alexa, open birthday countdown for Miranda"
"When is Miranda's birthday?"
"October 30th"
"Only eight days until Miranda's birthday!"

name: L. Cars
description:
L. Cars will boot up, tell you the current stardate in the style of Star Trek: TNG, and automatically close if there is no response from the user. A new feature added is decimal time. Ask "What time is it" and L. Cars will tell you the current decimal time. (Stardates and decimal time are approximate and based on UTC-05:00, "Eastern Time," they are also fictional and should not be used for actual time keeping). In both the television shows and movies set in the Star Trek Universe, the fictional "stardate" system of time keeping set the shows in a far off future. This skill will let you know the current stardate according to a proprietary calculation method unique to this skill. For more information on the system used to devise the current stardate, please visit https://jhelman857.wixsite.com/home/stardate . For more information on decimal time please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_time .

You can say:

"Alexa, open L. Cars"
"Alexa, start L. Cars"
"Alexa, launch L. Cars"
"Alexa, ask L. Cars what the time is"
"Alexa, ask L. Cars what the date is"

"What is the Stardate"
"What is the Decimal Time?"
"Exit Program"

Upon invoking the skill it will run automatically and give you the current stardate. You can end the program by saying "Stop," or it will end automatically after approximately two minutes.

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or, if you aren't happy with the unique style of calculating the current stardate please be patient as we add alternatives.

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.

name: Bugle Call Alarm
description:
Kick-start your day with this super loud alarm of a military bugle call (Reveille). Perfect as a 'wake-up' alert for yourself.

LOUD ALARMS
Beeping? Huh! Forget that. These are 1 minute ridiculously loud alarms, designed to wake you up fast.

ROUTINE NOTE
Soon you will be able to add this Alexa Skill to your Routines. Until then, you must activate it manually when you wake up. We will let everyone know when you can add this skill as a routine!

REVIEWS
iHearFun wants you to have fun, with our mega fun & useful skills! But we really need your support to keep this skill free, so if you have a few minutes please leave a 5-star review. Thank you.

This sound is Public Domain from Wikipedia. 'Reveille', performed by Sergeant Codie Lynn Williams of Dallas (ceremonial bugler for Marine Barracks Washington).

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com
review: I have to keep “reminding” Alex about the clock. It will fail to chime every 15 minutes. You must ask Alex to open the application about 5 times before it remembers.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: calculation history

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!
review: Pentatonix uses this app in their Amazon ad

name: Area Code Skill
description: This skill can be used to get region information associated with any telephone number.
review: I only get the state that uses the area code I ask for

name: New Year Countdown
description: This skill is perfect for people that want to have a New Year's Eve countdown, or just want to hear a fun, ecstatic countdown from 10. This plays a group of people counting down, perfect for any event where you need to count down.
review: Wanted a real time countdown.  This just did a countdown from 10.  Probably not even accurate in seconds.

name: Memorial Day Countdown
description: Tells the number of days until Memorial Day. Just ask, "Alexa, open Memorial Day Countdown."
review: It dos not work

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: I've just played with it for a test and it works fine. The commands are a bit chunky for me to say but no biggie. It now tells you that it has been started and how to get the status and when you stop it gives the final time. Looks as though the developer listens to his or her customers.

name: Resistor Decoder
description:
Resistor Decoder tells you the value of one or more resistors when you read the resistors' color bands aloud. You can read through as many resistors as you like without re-launching the Skill or having to say "tell me the value of..." for each subsequent resistor. This provides a quick, hands-free way to sort through a pile of resistors.  

Resistor Decoder supports 3-, 4-, and 5-band resistors.  It also warns you if a resistor value isn't one of the Standard EIA Decade values.  (A non-standard value usually means you read the colors wrong.)
review: Super useful when soldering and you get your resistors mixed up.

name: Blaze Bot
description: Blaze bot lets you know if it's time to blaze in CST. (4:20 am/pm)
review: i’ve been asking for days and it is never time to blaze

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review:
I don't have an iPhone, so don't care about that lack of support.

This worked perfectly for me several times.  I even rebooted my phone just to see if it would work smoothly and it did.  If your phone is on vibrate or on silent, it will still make an alarm noise.

Default noise is very loud and annoying, but that's also perfect for this app and helps out be heard under from between the sofa cushions.

Only thing I don't like is the command:  "Open phone finder and find my phone".  Would really like that shortened or customizable to "find my phone".  Maybe someday they will improve the Routines to do this.

name: ZipCode
description:
ZipCode Skill provides city and state of a zipcode. You can say the zipcode and the skill will tell you which city and state is that zipcode.
It will give the city and state info for any U.S. city.
review: "Sorry I can't find the answer to the question I just heard" and other variations of unsuccessful responses.

name: Counter Girl
description: Counter Girl can count to a number, a number with Mississippi, a number by another number, a number by prime, and a number by another number in geometric sequence.

name: One Twenty Power Converter
description: In the United States most household electricity is at 120 volts.  Now you can convert with the magic of Alexa amperage values to wattage as well as wattage to amperage.
comment heading: Very useful skill. Saves time and work. Let Alexa do it for you. That's what she's there for!
review: This app deserves 7  stars. It is very powerful for anyone who does any electrical work. Not only does it save time and work, but it can improve accuracy by preventing human math calculation errors. Fast, accurate, easy, powerful, and convenient are words that best describe this skill.

name: Thunderstorm Sounds
description:
Ambient sounds from nature are proven to help boost your focus at work, sleep better at night, or just help improve your mindfulness altogether.

All you need to do is say Alexa start Best ThunderStorm Sounds, and she will play the track for 60 minutes. Saying Alexa loop on will keep her playing until you say stop. This is a perfect skill to leave on while you are asleep, to use for relaxation and meditation, or to tune in and focus on your work. 

That's all there is to it! We hope you enjoy this. 

Please leave us a 5 star review if you like this skill so we can continue bringing you more great skills for free!

"Alexa, start Best Thunderstorm Sounds"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at dmsystems2016@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: Watch Dog
description:
Watch Dog provides basic functionality for tracking the comings and goings of family members in Echo-enabled homes. You can tell it when someone is leaving or returning, and ask for info on someone who has previously left.

There are no external dependencies for Watch Dog users, so simply download the Skill and begin!

name: Gift Ideas
description:
Ever find yourself trying to come up with good gift ideas for your friends or family members at the last minute, and you're angry with yourself because you KNOW you had a great idea for them months ago?  Well now you don't need to have that struggle any longer!  With Gift Ideas for Alexa, you can simply tell the skill your idea and it will remember it for you and when you're ready for your ideas, simply ask Alexa again.  It's that easy!

COMING SOON:
We intend to add specific birth date and event-specific gift idea tracking (i.e. you might have some ideas for someone specifically for Christmas vs. their birthday) and a Flash Briefing skill that will use those dates to remind you about shopping when those dates are getting close.  Stay tuned for more!

Wake up to the sound of the countryside with a rooster !

review: Very realistic. Would like to be able to link it to alarm.

name: note me (beta)
description:
The skill is in beta mode and may have some bugs, you can report bugs and give recommendations for improving the skill. 

Note me allows you to save short notes and recall them whenever you ask Alexa to play the notes or messages back to you. You can save up to 5 messages or notes. You can also delete them by saying delete. 
** Automatically registers the user on enabling skill and deletes him/her from database if all notes deleted or skill is disabled.
 
Example : 
"Alexa launch note me"
" save I am going to the store tomorrow"

" play" Alexa will play the note back You in her voice 

"Delete" Alexa will delete the messages
"Delete first note" deletes the first note only
review: Itis new but will work I’m sure if it

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: Too many people these days are claiming that they have a chat but, when actually it is a decision-making tree that is preprogrammed to respond to limited amount of text. This is another example of someone Miss representing themselves

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: Seems to work as advertised with no issues

name: The Mayan Calendar
description:
Itzamna' is the son of the creator god Hunab Ku, and ruler of the heavens, day, and night.  He gave the Mayans the foundations of their civilization including growing corn, writing, the calendar and medicine.
With this skill, Alexa can ask Itzamna' the current day on the Mayan calendar which consists of five interlocking cycles of different lengths called "baktun", "katun", "tun", "uinal" and "kin".
review: Fun little skill with a nice history twist

name: SwiftFinder
description:
Are you always looking for something? Let SwiftFinder help you find it! Pair your things with the SwiftFinder app and Alexa can ring the things you left.

To setup:
1.) Enable the SwiftFinder Skill by SwiftFinder in the Alexa app.
2.) Download the SwiftFinder app from the Apple App Store on your smartphone.
3.) Launch the SwiftFinder app.
4.) Ask Alexa for your PIN, Just say, "Alexa, ask okay swift to generate my PIN code".
5.) Enter the PIN provided by Alexa into the SwiftFinder app and tap Submit.
6.) Ask Alexa to ring my phone

"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
comment heading: Great app. I’m always losing my phone in my ...
review: Great app.  I’m always losing my phone in my house so it’s great to be able to tell Alexa to call my phone.

name: Doomsday
description:
Now you can find out when the Internet will stop working! A common problem known in computer engineering is the Year 2038 problem. This problem describes how the Internet's "time" will be reset to January 1, 1970 - 12 AM due to the binary encoding of 32-bit integers. This special date is "when" the internet started.

A lot of other computer systems build off this very fundamental date and time, but since this was implemented so long ago, an update would be required for nearly every computer system on the planet to continue working. This app tells you how much longer we have until the Internet (and pretty much any electronic device) stops working!
review: Doesn’t get better

name: Random Number
description: A simple skill, Alexa will give you a random number between 1 and 100. Useful for settling the sibling squabble about who gets the last slice of cake.

name: Bike Genius
description: A hands-free resource for people who work on or simply enjoy bikes.   Offers up a number of solutions for bikey-people to calculate things like gear ratios, gear inches, number of skid marks they can produce on their gearing, and other fun facts.
review: Great for the workshop. Easy way to get quick facts while your hands are too greasy to touch your phone.

name: Currency Converter
description: Ask Alexa to convert money from your country to other country. She will look for the current exchange rate and tell you what is the amount of the money that your currency represents in other countries. You can ask her too about conversion from other currencies or exchange rate from several currencies all around the world.
comment heading: Less than useless with almost no useful currencies
review:
Has about 6 currencies. Why would a currency converter have Nicaraguan and Venezuelan currencies but not Australian or the main Asian ones? I know that Alexa isn't enabled in these countries but has Amazon ever considered that it's customers may have international trade or travel needs?

Come back Google I miss you.

name: Memory Bank
description:
You are in the middle of making dinner, and are just about to add the cheese when the phone rings. You are on Step 5 of some instructions when the doorbell rings. You just remembered you need to call Dave back, when your spouse or child demands attention 'Right Now'.

Memory Bank comes to the rescue in these, and many other situations. Call on Memory Bank to remember whatever it was you were doing. Then, after handling the situation that interrupted you, ask Memory Bank to recall the memory. 

Memory Bank is meant to be fast and simple because you may only have a few seconds preserve the memory before devoting your entire attention to the interruption. As such, it can only remember one thing at a time for you. Asking Memory Bank to remember a second memory will overwrite the first, but you can record a memory with a single sentence.

For example: Alexa ask Memory Bank to remember that I need to mix in the chili powder, but I only want to use 1 tablespoon.

name: Binary Conversion
description: Ask alexa to convert a number into it's binary quivalent, and alexa will read back the sequence of 1's and 0's back to you. You can ask "what is the binary of 16?" and alexa will read back "The binary for 16 is 1, 0, 0, 0, 0"

name: Practice Logger
description:
PracticeLogger is a simple skill that allows you to keep track of how often you practice your musical instrument.  This can also be applied to anything that you want to monitor how often you do.  No one will judge your habits!

This skill offers the following features:
- Listen to daily, weekly, monthly and yearly statistics.
- Add a number of minutes to a day.
- Request the number of minutes from a specific day.
- Remove a number of minutes from a day.
- Remove all time from a day.
- Reset all so that you can start over again.

This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: I don't think it's worthy to have this when you can ask Alexa to do the figuring for you.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: 'Open Stopwatch, and Start' - the stopwatch is now running. Annoyingly, no reply is offered by Alexa letting you know that the stopwatch is running, Having heard no reply, I assumed that Alexa had not heard the request and so I began to repeat the request. Only then does Alexa tell me that there is a stopwatch already in progress. Ugh. Dear Developers, please include a reply in the programming of this skill so that one knows that the request has been heard and complied. Even in Star Trek, a simple response is the base of all operations. If Hollywood gets it you would like to think that the rest of the world would get it as well.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
review:
Alexa, start stopwatch
Alarm for what time?

Preferred rating: zero stars. Don't waste your time trying.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.
review: I like it...can I use it to make international calls?

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
comment heading: Esta bien yo le mejoraria el estilo visual del la app
review: todo ok

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".

description:
Once you have set up an account and paired your Cube with the Cube Tracker app you can use Alexa to find your stuff.
Say things like "Alexa ask Cube Tracker to ring my phone", or "Alexa ask Cube Tracker to find my keys"
The tracking of lost items using Cube is a free service.

comment heading: Doesn't work, Keeps defaulting to Tile
review: I have both Tile and Cube trackers. The Alexa skill always thinks I want Tile and rings that. When I do trick Alexa into going to Cube it always says cannot connect to phone, but the phone app works fine.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: Much awaited calculator app for alexa. Does the work perfectly well.

description:
Fan noises is a skill to help you _____________________.

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at _____________. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: My Extra Brain
description: Just ask for a quick reminder, and we'll send you a text at the time. This isn't a fancy reminder service with snoozing, repeating reminders, or any of that jazz. Just ask us, and we'll remind you. The skill works by securely storing your phone number and reminders associated with your unique Alexa userId. Then, when it's time for your reminder, we send your reminder to you via SMS. Standard text messaging rates from your carrier apply. Reminders will be sent from the number 37083.
review: Asked for a couple of easy reminders. One at a specified time and other in 30 minutes and got no reminder for either.

name: Any.do
description:

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
review: If you're a butt hurt liberal who hates America, then you'll love this skill.  If you're not a cry baby and believe in democracy, then get a life and suck it up!

name: Gift Ideas
description:
Ever find yourself trying to come up with good gift ideas for your friends or family members at the last minute, and you're angry with yourself because you KNOW you had a great idea for them months ago?  Well now you don't need to have that struggle any longer!  With Gift Ideas for Alexa, you can simply tell the skill your idea and it will remember it for you and when you're ready for your ideas, simply ask Alexa again.  It's that easy!

COMING SOON:
We intend to add specific birth date and event-specific gift idea tracking (i.e. you might have some ideas for someone specifically for Christmas vs. their birthday) and a Flash Briefing skill that will use those dates to remind you about shopping when those dates are getting close.  Stay tuned for more!
review: Alexa translated a name incorrectly and I was not able to figure out how to correct this. Between the lack of documentation regarding how to use this skill and the fact that I was not able to submit a help request related to this, I disabled this skill

name: Bugle Call Alarm
description:
Kick-start your day with this super loud alarm of a military bugle call (Reveille). Perfect as a 'wake-up' alert for yourself.

LOUD ALARMS
Beeping? Huh! Forget that. These are 1 minute ridiculously loud alarms, designed to wake you up fast.

ROUTINE NOTE
Soon you will be able to add this Alexa Skill to your Routines. Until then, you must activate it manually when you wake up. We will let everyone know when you can add this skill as a routine!

REVIEWS
iHearFun wants you to have fun, with our mega fun & useful skills! But we really need your support to keep this skill free, so if you have a few minutes please leave a 5-star review. Thank you.

CREDITS
This sound is Public Domain from Wikipedia. 'Reveille', performed by Sergeant Codie Lynn Williams of Dallas (ceremonial bugler for Marine Barracks Washington).

review: This app works very well. I have asked for the time in several countries and it was very accurate. I would recommend it for anyone who has family across the United States and in other countries.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

comment heading: Works Instanly and Flawless on all my Devices
review: The Any.do app is my go-to app. It works flawlessly with Alexa. I use the free version because I only use it for my grocery list and tasks. My grocery list is so easy to accomplish. When we start to run out of products, we just ask Alexa to place it on the list. I have tried other lists out there, some are great but this is my favorite out of all of them. My teenagers like it because they know what chores they need to do. It's a nice little app.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
comment heading: 5 star for the fun experience and their effort
review:
If you want to try all the cool smart home scenario without the hassle of interfacing with them individually, Mosaic + Alexa is by far the best/most mature solution I've ever used.

seems like the developers has put lots of thoughts into the product. They keep updating with new cool features.

One thing I love is to be able to use slack to control those smart devices, I can just be lazier.

I can even control my Tesla, which is unbelievable.

Anyway, 5 star rating for the experience, fun, and effort they've put into this skill.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

name: WiFi Password
description:
Enter your WiFi network name and password and Alexa will tell them to your friends and family. Forget questions about your network!

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)
review: Love this skill.  I have people over all the time, and want to connect them to my wi-fi.  Instead of writing it down and gluing it to my refrigerator, then looking for the paper when the post-it falls off - I just Ask my Echo Dot for it.  My friends are always impressed by it, which is a bonus to sell the Echo Dot on Amazon amid the bad reviews of saving recordings.  I LOVE my Echo Dot.

name: Remember Your Keys
description: Have Alexa help you figure out if you remembered to do everything you need to do before you leave the house. Did you remember your keys? How about your wallet? And did you turn the oven off so your house won't be filled with smoke when you come back?
comment heading: Is this the I am soooo drunk and need to go to the bar app or what?
review: What I really wanted was multiple to do lists in the Alexa app so I can break tasks down into categories but so far that isn't possible. So I searched skills for additional to do lists that might have that ability but didn't find anything... However, I did see this skill and I thought maybe I could at least get one more reminder list. Nope. First off, it was hard for me to launch...Alexa just kept adding 'keys' to my to do list, which I then have to go to the app and clear.. finally did get it launched and here is what it asked me.... Do I have my keys? Do I have my ID?  Do I have a payment method? Ummmm.... really? if you can't remember that stuff then you are probably drunk. So if you frequently head down to the bar when you are already drunk and can't remember what to take then this is probably a great app for you. If the questions were modifiable it wouldn't be bad but with only the canned questions it is pretty useless.

name: Moon Calendar Skill
description: This skill gives dates of moon phases, eclipses, solstices, and equinoxes. All you have to do is ask Alexa what events are going to be happening.

name: Tracfone
description:
Use your Ask Tracfone Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Tracfone Wireless Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Tracfone Wireless Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Tracfone Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Tracfone to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Tracfone Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check tracfone.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Tracfone phone and service. Go to www.tracfone.com for more details.

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.
comment heading: Can't get remember this to work.
review: Where do you send a text to.  No place to type on the app to send the list.  It doesn't accept verbal list.  Help!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: I like there's a stopwatch app. The commands are not intuitive at all, which makes this painful to use.

name: Mehul Arti
description:
Jay Sadguru Swami or the Swaminarayan Arti is the arti sung in all the Swaminarayan Sampraday mandirs. Arti is conducted by the singing of a special prayer and the playing of musical instruments. The piece was composed by Muktanand Swami on 5 November 1802.[1][2] During the aarti, a lighted ghee lamp with wicks is waved before murtis, representations of Swaminarayan and other deities.[3] Swaminarayan is believed to be physically manifest in the murti, and several arti ceremonies are performed throughout the day, allowing devotees to show their devotion. As the murti is not permanently on view for devotees, the arti is an important opportunity to gain blessings through darshan of a physical manifestation of Swaminarayan. In shikharbaddha mandirs, aarti is performed five times a day according to Vaishnava tradition, while In dev mandirs or Hari mandirs, arti is performed in the morning and evening only.[4] The BAPS version of the aarti is based on an original manuscript of Muktanand Swami’s works.[5]

You can say:

"Alexa, open Mehul Arti"
"Alexa, start Mehul Arti"
"Alexa, launch Mehul Arti"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at all.feedback@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: works as stated

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com

name: counting coach
description:

Examples:

Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to twenty (will count in a regular 1 second pace from 1 to 20).

Alexa, tell Counting Coach to from one to eight fast (won't pause as much).

Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to 3 very slowly (will make a longer pause between numbers and pronounce slowly and more clearly).

You can ask the skill to count between two numbers and to do it slow, very slowly, fast and very fast.

name: Pitch Pipe
description:
Pitch Pipe is a digital chromatic pitch pipe that plays any of the thirteen pitches in an octave, each a half step above the previous. This includes: A flat, A, B flat, B, C, C sharp, D, E flat, E (low and high), F, F sharp, G. 

Use Pitch Pipe as a pitch reference for your singing or instrument tuning. 

To hear a pitch, say "Alexa, ask Pitch Pipe..."

- "to play high E"
- "play the key of C sharp"

Enjoy!
comment heading: Great idea, but the skill has a lot of ...
review: Great idea, but the skill has a lot of trouble understanding what the user is asking for. The examples given only work sporadically. Not sure if the issue is the skill or Alexa itself, but either way, it is not very easy to use.

name: Color Convert
description:
This skill gives you a quick way to ask Alexa what a hex color might be when converted to rgb or hsl, and vice versa.

Hex - Can be given in either 6 or 3 digit format (#ff0000, #f00)
RGB - Given in format 255 0 255
HSL - Given in format 360 100 100 (Note that saturation and lightness are 0-100 scale, not 0-1)

Note, when giving rgb or hsl values, any values over one hundred need to be pronounced as so. So if you want to say 255, make sure you say two hundred and fifty five instead of two fifty five.

name: Age Calculator
description: The Age Calculator helps you calculate age between now and a given date, whether in the past or future. Depending on the length of time, it will provide the number of days, months, or years, as appropriate. When the year is unspecified, the next year will be used by default.
review: It only seems to use the year and does not use month or day. Anyone born in 1952 gets the same answer whether born in January or December

name: Num Rand
description: Num Rand will give you a random number within a given range. Ask it for a number between two integers, and it'll generate a new random number, inclusive of the two you gave it.
review: Echo can already do this you idiot

name: UTC Time in Morse Code
description:
This is a simple skill to give Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time in Morse Code. It provides an another opportunity to practice listening skills.  
Details of development: I used the new beta AWS Developer Console function that develops your code inline which makes creating a new skill a no brainer and very fast. Could have done it in a couple hours had I known the syntax of subscript and how to create acceptable mp3 files for S3. As it was it took about a day to get everything done.
Found out that the mp3 file format must be 16000 and 48k or it won't work. 
Finally, it would be nice to get the user's local time and there is an API for that but unfortunately the API returns a text version of the users timezone (Like Africa) so you would need a database to look up the time offset from UTC. Too much work so this little skill just returns UTC. I know that I live in a timezone that is 8 hours ahead of UTC.
Anyway, it was a good exercise and it is nice to know it is so easy to make a skill now compared to earlier versions of AWS Skill Kit.

name: Baby Classic Music
description:
If your lips are falling off from the amount of soothing shushing you've been doing then Baby Classic Music is THE skill for you. Baby Classic Music uses a thoroughly tested technique designed to calm a baby and help them sleep.

These beautiful classic music tracks will help relax you and baby, ready for sleep. The playlist is just over an hour and will play on loop until you decide to stop it.

To play it, you can say:

"Alexa, open Baby Classic Music"
"Alexa, start Baby Classic Music"
"Alexa, launch Baby Classic Music"

Please leave a review if you love this skill so other moms and dads can enjoy some peace and quiet :)
review: very relaxing

name: How Many Days
description:
Open the skill and Alexa will automatically tell you how many days remain until all your upcoming events. Alexa can also remind you about the exact date for a specific events.

review: no matter what you do, it wont take dates, it will give you irrelevant information that has nothing to do with your question

name: Baby Weight Tracker
description: As a parent whose children needed careful weight monitoring as babies, I found that trying to juggle the scale, my phone, and the baby, to keep track of daily weights and understand the recent average trend, was often more than I could handle in my sleep-deprived state :) So I wanted to make a simple skill that does just this one thing easily. Weigh your baby with your home scale, say "open baby weight," and then for example, "ten pounds four and a half ounces," (or kilograms and grams if you like) and that's it. After the second day recording weight, you'll start to hear back the change since last time. After a week of tracking, you'll be able to say "report" and get the recent daily average change. A well-rested adult with one hand reliably free could probably do this pretty easily with a notepad :) But for those of us who don't fit that description during the first year of our children's lives, well, I hope this skill helps. Apologies but this first version can only track one child's weight at a time. One last thing, if you just want to record one quick weight, it's not necessary to open and log in separate steps. You can just say, "Alexa, tell baby weight fifteen pounds nine ounces." Happy tracking!
review: Very cool skill, helpful and easy to use.
