name: hey yinz
description:
Ever wanted to talk like a born and raised Pittsburgher? Well, this app can help you practice. It will translate any phrase you say into Pittsburghese. Note: a phrase might not have a distinct Pittsburghese translate so you might just hear the same phrase repeated back to you. 
 
 After the skill replies, you can also ask Alexa to repeat or slow down the last translation.
review: This app always has to know stuff.. Pretty  nebby if you ask me.

name: Apache Trash Day
description: TrashDay uses the TDS calendar (example here: http://www.texasdisposal.com/sites/default/files/uploads/TDS_ResidentialServiceCalendar-2016.pdf) to figure out when your next trash or recycle day is.
review: Worked great. Alexa told me trash pickup day and recycle day on first try.

name: Web Check
description:
Source code available at github. Search for alexa-web-check.
When you say "check amazon", it will check http://amazon.com and https://amazon.com and respond "website is up on HTTP only", "website is up on HTTPS only", "website is up on HTTP and HTTPS", or "website is down".
When you say "check my sites", it will get your site list you entered via https://alexa.agilesalt.com, and check them.
review: limited number of checks you may have

name: Zen Moods: Storm Sounds
description:
Experience a relaxing mood with the "Zen Moods: Storm Sounds". The skill is best suited for meditation, relaxation or falling asleep. 

TO USE: Click the 'Enable’ button in the Alexa App. Then say 'Alexa open storm sounds’ to listen.
TO LOOP: say 'Loop on'

If you enjoyed this skill please leave a 5-star review.
The app icon is made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com

++++++++++MAKE SURE TO CHECK OUT ++++++++++++

- Zen Moods: Rain Sounds
- Zen Moods: Forest Sounds
review: love it

name: Day of the year skill
description: Ask alexa and she will tell you current day of the year.
review: I just added this skill and it doesn't even give the correct day.  It is January 4th, and it says that it is day 5.  I live in the Pacific Time Zone, so I wonder if that's the problem.  If so, it needs to check time zones, and calculate accordingly.

name: Interval Notice
description: This is a custom timer that will notify you after a given interval of time for as many times as you like. The number of repetitions and the amount of time between each notification is up to you. The only limit is that the total amount of time has to be less than one hour.
comment heading: The skill DOES NOT DO what it says it does
review:
The Good:
This skill does what is says it will do. I like to do workouts on my elliptical and exercise bike where I increase the level of resistance every five minutes. I used to set an Echo timer every five minutes and then have to cancel it when it went off before setting the next five minutes. This works so much better. Set it once and it does the rest.
The Bad:
None that I can think of.

UPDATE:
I thought this skill worked but it doesn’t. It just stops after several intervals, without finishing the request. And any other request to the Echo processing this skill causes it to cancel. I love the IDEA of this skill and would love to use it. A shame the thing doesn’t actually work.
Observations:
I like the idea the one reviewer suggested who suggested a countdown option. I would like to also control the interval of the notice, like tell me every minute during the countdown. But, this wish does not impact my review of what the skill does do.

I HATE people who give a product a bad review because it does not do what THEY want it to do. If you don’t like what it does, then don’t use it. Write your own skill. Amazon give you that ability.

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
comment heading: This app is nice. it works flawlessly
review: I have noticed that people are getting more incompetent to figure out how to do a simple command without having to be an intellectual moron. just enable the app. Next, you say Alexa. Give a slight pause. Then follow through with open my calculator.  After it does that then you can calculate. I thank the creator of this app because it does what is is instructed.  These wanna be critics need to get their heads out of Google University and e-mail their incompetent issues with the authors of the app, instead of slinging your incompetent crap in the review.  So please stop and use your brains for once.

name: Hackster Fan Page Likes Counter
description: This skill count the likes on Hackster Facebook Fanpage
review: awesome skill!

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
comment heading: id like to suggest to include 'add X minutes' and 'remove ...
review: usefull skill, id like to suggest to include 'add X minutes' and 'remove X minutes' , and seconds, and hours...

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review:
I connected my phone with an alarm tone works great, nice and loud
I muted my phone and it still works fine. Not sure what was going on in the poor review scenarios.

name: New Year Countdown
description: This skill is perfect for people that want to have a New Year's Eve countdown, or just want to hear a fun, ecstatic countdown from 10. This plays a group of people counting down, perfect for any event where you need to count down.
review: Did nothing helpful

name: Good Morning Vietnam
description:
Good Morning, Vietnam is a 1987 American comedy-drama war film written by Mitch Markowitz and directed by Barry Levinson. 

Set in Saigon in 1965, during the Vietnam War, the film stars Robin Williams as a radio DJ on Armed Forces Radio Service, who proves hugely popular with the troops, but infuriates his superiors with what they call his "irreverent tendency". 

The story is loosely based on the experiences of AFRS radio DJ Adrian Cronauer.

And now alexa can start your day with this awesome, iconic line. 

You can say:

"Alexa, open Good Morning Vietnam"
"Alexa, start Good Morning Vietnam"
"Alexa, launch Good Morning Vietnam"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at dmsystems2016@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: There's no way to use it as an alarm to wake up to. It always says Welcome and the thanks for listening. Come on programmers, a little more effort please.

description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.

name: Where's My Droid
description:
Use the original phone tracking app to find your phone. You can have Alexa make your phone ring on full volume or track it with the phones GPS.

Setup:
First you'll need to download the Where's My Droid app on your phone from Google Play. Run the app and setup a Commander account. You'll then log into that Commander account through the Alexa app to link your account.
review: Doesn't allow me to link

name: Lunar Date
description: Want to know what lunar date is today? This skill can help by just saying "ask Lunar Date".

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com
review: Unlocks the connection to my smart home devices in the ways I expected Alexa to from the start.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do

name: Someone Surprised
description: Have Alexa repeat your phrase after a delay of your choosing by saying: "Alexa, tell/ask Someone Surprised [say your phrase] in/after [say any delay in minutes or seconds less than 11 minutes]" . For example: "Alexa, tell Someone Surprised 'good morning, welcome to the kitchen' in 55 seconds." Or, another example: "Alexa, ask Someone Surprised after 10 minutes 'are you just going to sit there all morning?" Try to predict when someone will be within earshot and leave a surprising message for them.

name: Starfish Track
description:
You can use the skill to find locations of your loved one's as well as yourself. Also you can ring a lost phone loudly even if it's on silent mode. You can ring phone's of all relatives who are linked to your household account on Starfish. To switch off sound click on the alert you receive or open our app "Starfish Mint" on your phone. You will need our mobile app and a subscribed user id to be shared between household. Every time you request someone's location they get an alert and you get to know where they are. We have apps for Android and IOS. To link your mobile phone download our app (Search for Starfish Mint or you get a link when you register on our website in our welcome pack email) and goto Mobile Services/Starfish Track section.

You can setup your skill following below steps. You will find more details on our website:

1. Register for a  www.starfishmint.com account. If you use any of our other skills then you don't need to register again. All our skills requires account linking
2. Link you alexa skill with your starfishmint.com. Account linking gets triggered when you try and enable the skill. You must link if you want to do anything beyond launch prompt
3. Login to www.starfishmint.com and subscribe for skills. If you have an active subscription then you don't need to subscribe again.
4. Download our Mobile app to all members of your household and in Mobile Services/Starfish Track section login with the same user id on all mobile devices.
5. Assign a relation name to the mobile phone. This screen is presented after login screen

. That is it you are all setup to ask Alexa for Starfish Track.
review: You can track as well as ring your phone. Also others in your family. Very cool

name: WiFi Password

If you like the skill, please submit a review :)

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: wrong time

review: This timer is off by a factor of 4 years. Just like the developer Spencer, 4 years off and $4 short. Don’t waste your time.

name: Resistor Assistant
description: This is a simple app that assists you with decoding the three color bands on resistors as well as calculating the effective resistance of two resistors in parallel or series.  It is possible to use the decoded resistor as one of the resistances in the series or parallel calculation.  If you do not provide enough information for calculating an effective resistance, resutil will prompt you for the missing information.
review: Works OK, but what would really be nice would be if you could state the desired resistance (like 22 Meg) and have it give you the color code to use. When I am building a circuit, I usually know the resistance I need and want to know what color code to pull out of the box, not pick up a resistor and then design a circuit that will fit that color resistance. The same holds true to the parallel and series calculation. I need to know what resistors to combine to get a certain value, not what the resistance of a combination is.

name: APRS
description: Locate APRS stations using the APSR Internet System, and reverse-geocode the locations to approximate addresses.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.
review: I can't link to my Just Energy acc

name: Aether Air Quality Reporter
description:

Retrieves the current air quality index (AQI) of pm 2.5 from www.airnowapi.org.

review: I want to know how many days I still have to get up and go to work! I do not want weekends included in the count. As a bonus, it would be nice to be able to designate vacation days or holidays to be excluded from the count as well.

review:
We have had Alexa in our Home for a few years now.  We have had the Echo 1st and 2nd Generation, the Dots 1st and 2nd generations.  Then we upgraded later to replacing all the dots with the Spots.  Also added a few Shows in the house as well.  Now we have some type of Amazon Alexa device in every room in our home.  We just love them!!!  For News, Music, ordering, and just about everything to control your home, there is No better system!
Every home should have Amazon Alexa control devices.  The Skills that it can do are tremendous and they keep getting better and better.
No home should be without this system !

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: Great task manager

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

review: I think my Alexa has a bit of retard in her

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!
review: just trying to add a series of numbers, shouldn't be that hard. disabled the skill

name: Bike Share
description:
NOTE: Bike Share only currently supports Citibike in New York City. Stay tuned for support for more bike share systems across the country!

Bike Share allows you to quickly find the closest bike share station to your address with bikes available! Use it on the way out of the house in the morning to avoid walking to an empty station. If a station has less than 3 bikes available, Bike Share will also let you know  the next station that is more populated. 

First, you need to add the address where your Amazon Echo resides. Start by saying:
"Add an Address."

Alexa will prompt you, step by step, to add your address, starting with your house number. For example, if your address was 350 5th Avenue, 10118, when prompted for your house number, you would say "three fifty".

Next, Bike Share will ask for your street name. Using the above example address, you would say "fifth avenue".

Finally, Bike Share will ask for your zip code. In the above example, you would answer, "one zero one one eight".

Once saved, you can then ask at any time to find the closest bike. Just say: "find me a bike."
Alexa will remember your address indefinitely, so you'll never need to add an address again unless you move your Echo. 

If you need to change your address, just tell Bike Share: "change my address". Alexa will ask if you want to overwrite your current address; if you respond "yes", you will be given the chance to enter a new address.

name: Retirement Countdown
description: Tech-savvy members of the workforce may not have a whiteboard with the number of days left, but they are probably curious enough about when their last day of work is coming up. Retirement Countdown is an Amazon Alexa skill built to help these soon-to-be-retirees know simply by asking. Retirement Countdown will record the last day of work and then give the time left until freedom.

review: Waste of time.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
review: Does not show stopwatch

name: Interval Notice
description: This is a custom timer that will notify you after a given interval of time for as many times as you like. The number of repetitions and the amount of time between each notification is up to you. The only limit is that the total amount of time has to be less than one hour.

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.

skills-rest: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
name: City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule
description:
UPDATED for English-Canada as of January 26th, 2018! This skill was originally developed for English-US before Alexa was available in Canada and it had problems for people that were using English-Canada as their language.  It now works for everyone. Huzah!

You can use the City of Ottawa Garbage Pickup Schedule to find out the date of your next pickup. Sometimes holidays will change the date of the pickup, or perhaps you just don't remember if you have to take out garbage or recycling this week. Now you can just ask Alexa to find out when you need to take out the garbage.

Please make sure to prefix your question with "Alexa ask Ottawa Garbage". You can also say "Alexa, open Ottawa Garbage" and the app will ask you if you want to know the next pick up date.  You can't just say "Alexa, when is garbage day". I wish all skills worked like that but they don't. For many skills including this one, you need to address them by name.

If you're address isn't recognized, hit me up on twitter @stevemulligan or email steve@nonlocal.ca and I will do my best to get the skill working properly for you.
review:
This is a great skill, it even takes holidays into account. All you have to do is say “Alexa, ask Ottawa garbage when is the next pickup date”. Just like the instructions say... and the developer is really friendly and will update the skill if you add other wordings for using it.

If you had a problem using it, it’s most likely because you didn’t invoke it properly, like you said “Alexa when is the next pickup date” and you left out the crucial “Ottawa garbage” part. That’s a limitation amazon imposes on skills, not the developers fault. You can also say “Alexa open Ottawa garbage” if that’s easier for you.

name: Assist Reminder
description:
Assist Reminder will help you remember where you have put any of your items. You can do this by telling Alexa to remember where you have put certain things. Then you can tell Alexa to remind you where you have put these things. For example, you could say, "Alexa, tell Assist Reminder I put my wallet on desk ". After which you can say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder where is my wallet" and Alexa will tell you your wallet is on your desk. This is helpful for when you can not find your things, such as your badge, laptop, headphones, etc.
To get a list of all your reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to list all".
If you don't need the reminders, please say "Alexa, ask Assist Reminder to clear".
review:
Seeing I have trouble remembering where I put things. I thought this skill would be helpful. I tried every which way to
Get this skill to work. I asked Alexa to remember where I put my car keys. She did,  then asked if I wanted to remember any new thing, I said no. Then she said list is cleared. I then asked her for where I put my car keys, she replied I don’t know where your car keys are. So she erased the list and was not suppose to.

review: Interesting and nice idea.  Thanks!

name: Number Converter
description: This skill allows you to convert base 10 decimal numbers into different radixes between 2 and 36. Cards are also sent to the alexa app with your conversion.
comment heading: Incorrect results when letters in hex numbers.
review:
Maybe it's just "C" -- converting 194 decimal to "hex" returned "1002." At first I thought maybe it thought I meant base 6. But after manually calculating that number, and then manually calculating 194 to hexadecimal (C2), I think I see the problem. For some reason, it's converting the "C" to 100, despite not, apparently being able to convert Roman numerals.

Anything it doesn't understand, it will just ask "what number do you want to convert" over and over to all responses until you tell it to stop.
Don't know if the other reviewer is being a troll, but this doesn't appear to be a remotely functional skill.

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).
review: My stopwatch has been running for over 230 days, and no matter what i do, it will not stip

name: Bin reminder
description:
*NEW* Version Update 2.2! (See below)
**Now supports multiple bin types. Currently supports recycling,
black, general, green, brown, blue, pink,
white,grey,red,yellow,orange, glass and garden**

**Request a new bin type by sending email to alexaozcalendar@gmail.com**


Let Bin Reminder  know what frequency your bins go out and also do they start this week or next.

To get started, you simply need to say 'Open Bin Reminder,' and you will be guided through the flow.
Once the initial setup is configured, it will be stored for future reference.

If you move house or your bin frequency changes, no problem! You can reset and start again by saying "Alexa, ask Bin Reminder to reset".

The skill supports ISO week of the year. That means, weeks start with Monday.

To view a quick demo, check out link below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kB2EBVTSPkQ


**Feedback**:

You can email me directly at alexaozcalendar@gmail.com
 with any questions, comments or concerns.

Future releases will offer additional features based on community feedback.


Update 1.1:
-Added in day of the week as part of the initial setup. If applicable, Bin Reminder will respond with day of week your bin goes out. Backwards compatible with existing users state. If you want to add day of week, reset and start the setup again.
-Introduced SSML Speechcons, which are special words and phrases that are pronounced more expressively by Alexa.
-Improved error handling

Update 1.2:
-Added in weekly as frequency choice
-Fixed issue with week day choice not interpreted correctly
-Added in sample video clip to demo setup. See above

Update 2.0:
-Handle multiple bin types. Bin reminder now allows you to setup multiple bin types.
It will now tell you (if applicable) what bins already went out this week and what bins are due out

Update 2.1:
-Add in frequency of four weeks
-New bin types

Update 2.2:
-Tell you if bins also go out next week

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

name: Doomsday
description:
Now you can find out when the Internet will stop working! A common problem known in computer engineering is the Year 2038 problem. This problem describes how the Internet's "time" will be reset to January 1, 1970 - 12 AM due to the binary encoding of 32-bit integers. This special date is "when" the internet started.

A lot of other computer systems build off this very fundamental date and time, but since this was implemented so long ago, an update would be required for nearly every computer system on the planet to continue working. This app tells you how much longer we have until the Internet (and pretty much any electronic device) stops working!
review: Super awesome app that tells you the exact time until the 2038 problem! Keep up the good work!

name: School Kit
description:
School Kit lets you keep track of the stuff your kids need for school. 

To build up the list of kit for each day, use "Alexa, ask School Kit to add kit for Tuesday". You'll be prompted for the item of kit you want to add and who it is for. 
Alternatively, use "Alexa, open School Kit. Add Games Kit for Thomas for Tuesday". 
You can add as many items you like for as many children as you have. 

Once your kit lists are in place, use "Alexa, ask School Kit what kit I need for Tomorrow" or "Alexa, ask School Kit what kit Sarah needs on Wednesday" and Alexa will tell you what you need.

To remove items of kit, use "Alexa, ask School Kit to remove kit for Wednesday" to clear all items from Wednesday or "Alexa, open School Kit. Remove Games Kit from Thomas on Tuesday" to remove a single item.

If you have a two week timetable, you can set up two week's worth of kit. School Kit will keep track of which week is current and tell you what kit you need. If the weeks get out of sync due to holidays, you can switch which of the two weeks is current.

First, ask Alexa to switch to a two week timetable by saying "Alexa, open School Kit. Set the timetable to two weeks.". 

School kit can only set up one week of kit at a time so add kit as described above for the first week then switch to the second. To switch between weeks say  "Alexa, ask School Kit to switch weeks". You can then add the kit you need for the second week and when you are done, switch back to the first week by again saying "Alexa, ask School Kit to switch weeks".

When you're done, ask what kit you need as normal and if the date falls in the second week School Kit will tell you the kit from week two. 

If you change your mind, you can always say "Alexa, ask School Kit to set the timetable to one week" to go back to a one week timetable. 

Have fun at school!
review: I am using the kits to make a list of what I need for projects. I converted the name of the person to the name of the project.  The kit I need is listed the day before deadline. Still working with the different projects.

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
review:
After beginning the stopwatch, i used "ask stopwatch" to get the status. i did NOT receive any extra prompts. After that, i tried: "cancel stopwatch", "delete stopwatch", and "stop stopwatch."

I didn't try any other phrase because, in my opinion, the voice commands should be that intuitive. If i have to waste time trying to guess the magic words, well, ain't nobody got time for that.

I had to open the Alexa app on my phone and disable the skill to kill the stopwatch.

The only reason I gave it one star is because I couldn't submit this review with zero stars.

If you want to receive specific information just open a new twitter account and follow the relevant accounts. You can configure you own flash briefing in seconds.

Only english tweets are read. For a better experience the tweets are cleaned up.
After you have activated the skill you will be asked for a read-only access to your twitter account.

Feel free to send us feedback, bugs or feature request to twitter@futureofvoice.com

name: Calculator
description:
Calculator app for alexa. 
Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations. 
It also keeps your current answer in context so that you can operate on it. 
If you need to check your calculations, it'll also read out the calculation history for you. Just say, "tell me the calculation history".
Sample Utterances:
For Addition - What's five point nine plus three; Add two point nine to the answer.
For Subtraction - What is five point nine minus three; Subtract two point nine from the answer.
For Multiplication - What is five point nine multiplied by three; Multiply two point nine by the answer.
For Division - What's five point nine divided by three; Divide the answer by two point nine.

Features coming soon:
- Nth power and Nth root
- Logarithmic operations 
- Trigonometric operations
- Saving answers to memory
- Power or e, power of 10, power of 2
- Degree and radian conversions
and many more!

name: Q-Code
description:
Q-Codes or Q-signals are a three letter shorthand for common ham radio expressions used on the air.  Many Q-Codes relate to CW (continous wave).
They are sepecially useful in Morse code.  Often in phone (voice communication) they are considered a bit to much like jargon and are discouraged.  
They are helpful when used between ham's that don't speak a common language.

1. type of call: land line, mobile, etc (if available)
2. carrier: if available
3. location: if available
comment heading: Looks nice until you get it cheap looking
review: I order a blouse, larger than my size I usually order and the blouses were to small and very cheap looking .  Now I need to return them and can’t get the return address

name: Phone Number Check
description:
the skill provides basic information about a 10 digit phone number in the United State:
1. type of call: land line, mobile, etc (if available)
2. carrier: if available
3. location: if available
review: just tell you if it cell or landline no help here...

name: Whisper Guy
description:
Ask Whisper Guy the time and he will tell you in a (creepy?) whisper. By default he tells you UTC/GMT time, so you would have to let him know what timezone you are in using the offset command. You only need to do this once, but can change it at any time. This is necessary as Amazon does not share timezone information with skills.

Whisper Guy also comes with two additional optional features:
1) Silent Open and
2) Horror Quote.

Silent open changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that when you open whisper guy, there is no audio response and it waits for your input. By default this setting is off. It also removes the lead in phrase from the reply time (it is now, the time is etc.) making the response shorter. To turn 'Silent Open' on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to on'. To turn 'Silent Open' off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set silent open to off'.

Horror quote changes Whisper Guy's behaviour so that five seconds after Whisper Guy tells the time, he whispers a quote from a horror movie. There are three modes for horror quote. The default mode is off. When off, Whisper Guy does not include a quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When on, Whisper Guy always includes a random quote from a horror movie after he whispers the time. When random, Whisper Guy randomly includes a quote (50% of the time) from a horror movie after he whispers the time. To turn horror quote on, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote on'. To turn horror quote off, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote off'. To change horror quote to be random, say 'Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to set horror quote random'.

Below is a list of the horror quotes that Whisper Guy knows:
That cold ain't the weather. That's death approaching.
They're all gonna laugh at you.
Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?
When there is no room left in hell, the dead will walk the earth.
What an excellent day for an exorcism.
Is that blood on your zombie?
It's Alive! It's Alive!
I should warn you, princess – the first time tends to get a little messy.
I've seen enough horror movies to know that any weirdo wearing a mask is never friendly.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
No tears please, it's a waste of good suffering.
You know that part in scary movies when somebody does something really stupid and everyone hates them for it? This is it.
I'm your number one fan.
Well, you just pissed me off.
Whatever you do, don't fall asleep.
Sometimes dead is better.
No more dead bodies for Daddy tonight.
They're here!
We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!
review: Just activated this skill, by following the suggestion in the comments it's working perfectly.  ("Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to offset minus six", "Alexa, ask Whisper Guy to turn horror quote on", and "Alexa ask Whisper Guy to set silent on". ) Gives me the correct time for my area and whispered a creepy quote. Only complaint it I wish he was a smidge louder. I know he's whispering :P but with the Dot at my regular using volume, couldn't really understand the quote though the time was clear enough. Don't know how much I'll use it but hey if nothing else, I can ask Alexa the time late at night without having her echoing through the the whole house. LOL

name: Web Check
description:
Source code available at github. Search for alexa-web-check.
When you say "check amazon", it will check http://amazon.com and https://amazon.com and respond "website is up on HTTP only", "website is up on HTTPS only", "website is up on HTTP and HTTPS", or "website is down".
When you say "check my sites", it will get your site list you entered via https://alexa.agilesalt.com, and check them.
review: agilesalt.com is now for sale; custom domains as directed by the instructions therefore are now impossible.

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: This is one of the most practical uses for Alexa so far. I can ask Alexa to add any item to my grocery list, my to-do list, my shopping list or any custom list that I define. These items are then automatically synced to my iPad and iPhone as well as my wife’s Apple devices.  Sometimes an item just pops into your head randomly, and if you don’t write it down immediately, you forget.  So this is a great way to create lists.  Four stars because you can’t remove items from your list through Alexa.  Rather you have to remove items from Alexa App or the Any.Do app.  In other words, it only works one way.

name: Shipco
description:
Vessel position tracking, including a global vessel and port database. Tools for the shipping industry, Maritime News and a lively community of shipspotters. The tracking system allows us to define the current position of the container, Container tracking system convenience to satisfy curiosity of current position of the container,
Customer can track from android device.

name: Translate This
description: Translate This is an application that anyone can use to translate some of the most basic words in the most common and important languages. By going through the prompts, you can quickly and easily get approximate translations that can be used immediately. Support for more languages, more phrases, and native pronunciation will shortly be implemented.
review: Three words? Seriously? Does anyone screen these apps before they're released?

name: Kiwi Holidays
description:
Tells you if there are scheduled New Zealand public holidays or regional anniversaries using information published by the NZ Government's Department of Internal Affairs. 

You can ask if there are holidays on a specific day or week.
comment heading: Does what it claims to do!
review: This is awesome - possibly the only skill of use to us specifically here in New Zealand :)

name: Battery State of Charge
description: Convert the measured battery voltage of a standard 12 volt car battery into a percentage state of charge.
comment heading: It will give you the wrong answers.  It says 12.5 volts is at a 40% state of charge.
review: It says that 12.5 volts is at a 40% state of charge.  12.5 volts is actually at an 80% state of charge.  These results were consistent each time I asked it.  The app is consistent with it's responses, but they are not the correct responses.  Please fix and update.  Thank you.

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic lets you do more things with your Alexa easily, from controlling Tesla, asking for commute, to triggering powerful workflows of many things. Mosaic supports Google Calendar, Fitbit, Nest, Philips Hue, Lifx, Jawbone, Withings, Automatic, Tesla, Rachio, Insteon, Weather, Commute, News and Ambient Sound, with many more to come.

Workflow Example:
Our "Good Morning" workflow can help you warm up the house, give you today's weather forecast, report your Tesla battery level and mile range, followed by a brief summary of your Google calendar events and commute time to work. 

Immediately enjoy predefined Mosaic workflows or customize your own with the devices and services you love. Whether it’s Good Morning, Chill out, or I am home - easily control your life with one simple command.

All these functionalities are also available by typing to Mosaic’s Chatbot on Facebook Messengers, Slack, and SMS. When talking is not convenient, typing also gets things done!

To get started,
First, enable the Mosaic Skill.
Second, create a Mosaic account at https://saymosaic.com 
Finally, just link your favorite devices and services and start enjoying our pre-defined Mosaic workflows or create your own.

A few popular commands from existing Mosaic users:
“Ask Mosaic to change the color to blue”
“Ask Mosaic to lock up Tesla”
“Ask Mosaic for calendar summary”
“Ask Mosaic to warm up the house”
“Ask Mosaic for Good Morning”
"Ask Mosaic to turn on living room"
"Ask Mosaic to play ambient sound"
"Ask Mosaic to read news"

More commands?
“Ask Mosaic to list commands”

Want to know more about the cool experiment inside Mosaic? Visit us at https://saymosaic.com

name: Remember Your Keys
description: Have Alexa help you figure out if you remembered to do everything you need to do before you leave the house. Did you remember your keys? How about your wallet? And did you turn the oven off so your house won't be filled with smoke when you come back?
review: I second R. Nadh's feedback

name: Phone Radar
description:
Easily find your phone by having Alexa give you a call.

To Setup

1. Say, Alexa, open phone radar, to get your pin
2. Call (864) 732-2395 and enter your pin
3. All done!

When you have lost your phone just say

Alexa, ask phone radar to call me

All calls come from
(864) 732-2395

Any issues or Comments?  Please send us an email with your phone number and we will look into it.
contact@blu3f1re.com

review: I use  Any.do whenever I shop.

name: Base Converter
description:
The Base Converter skill helps you convert values between decimal, hexadecimal, and binary. You can convert:
Binary to Decimal,
Binary to Hexadecimal,
Decimal to Binary,
Decimal to Hexadecimal,
Hexadecimal to Binary,
and Hexadecimal to Decimal.
This skill is useful for programmers, engineers, and computer gurus alike.

name: Relaxing Cat purring Sounds
description:
Click the 'Enable' button or say 'Alexa open relaxing cat purring sounds'. Then you can say 'Alexa open relaxing cat purring sounds' to begin skill.

Sleep well at night or bring peace to your busy life with Relaxing Sounds. Close your eyes and relax. These sounds are good for meditation or relaxation.

We use a high quality 8 hour audio stream, not 2 min loops with pauses some other sound providers use.

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!

name: Russian Bells
description: The unique & entrancing sound of the Kremlin and other Russian Orthodox churches.
review: You want bells.....ya got bells!

name: Deep Sleep Sounds
description:
Click the 'Enable' button or say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds'. Then you can say 'Alexa open Deep Sleep Sounds' to begin skill.

Sleep well at night or bring peace to your busy life with Relaxing Sounds. Close your eyes and relax. These sounds are good for meditation or relaxation.

We use a high quality 2 hour audio stream, not 2 min loops with pauses some other sound providers use.

If you love this skill please let us know by leaving a review!
review: I use it but it isn't as good as I had hoped. Does it have to ask me if I want to hear sounds to help my sleep every time I open the skill? Of course I do or I wouldn't have opened it. Also why does it say sounds like I have a choice of what I want to hear.

name: Resistor Reader
description:
Tell Alexa the color bands on a resistor and this skill will tell you how many ohms the resistor is along with its tolerance.

This skill supports resistors having from 3 to 5 bands.  If you read the bands in the wrong order it will automatically correct it for you, giving you the right value.
review: I've been using it works awesome.

name: GEGO - Locate what you love
description: GEGO Tracker skill requires a GEGO device available at https://gego.io. GEGO Tracker skill requires you to login to your GEGO account, created with the GEGO App, available for Android and iOS. With the GEGO Tracker skill, you can just say: Alexa, ask GEGO Tracker where is my stuff, and you will get an audio description detailing the position of each of your devices.
review: Skill response when asking where is my device is always “not sure“

name: Ens Birthdays
description: This will list a random birthday from the Ens family.  Later on, if I get ambitious, it will gain the ability to say the next birthday.  But not yet.

name: Swahili
description:
This version: User can ask Alexa for day of week and get a response in Swahili language.

Future Plan: User can ask Alexa for the weather, time of day, Tanzania Shilling exchange rate, local time in Dar es Salaam and Zanzibar.

name: Presidential Countdown
description: Need a countdown of how long until Donald J Trump's presidential term will last (if nothing cuts it short...). Use this skill to get a readout of the years, days, hours, and minutes remaining.
review: Pathetic. No other way to describe this skill or the people who need it

name: Holidays Calendar
description:
-This is a very simple and interesting Holidays Calendar.
-You can ask Years between 2017 and 2020 and Months to get details about Holidays of India. 
-If you need help ask help.

name: Recycling Reminder
description: Never have to judge if it's your recycling week by looking down the street.  Configure Recycling Reminder to remember your biweekly pickup week by saying, "Alexa, ask Recycling Reminder to remember my recycling week as" followed by "this week" or "next week".  To use Recycling Reminder, ask Alexa to "ask Recycling Reminder if pickup is this week" to have a quick reminder or simply, "open Recycling Reminder".
review: App says it remembers which week, then when you go back into the app, it does not remember and prompts you to start again. It gets one star in order to rate it. Also the prompt is too much of a mouthful. Needs a simpler prompt. Hopefully it will get fixed.

name: Random Number
description: A simple skill, Alexa will give you a random number between 1 and 100. Useful for settling the sibling squabble about who gets the last slice of cake.
review: Ugh

name: Stop Smoking Now
description:
Stop Smoking Now is a skill to help you overcome your smoking habit with something you are super passionate about. Listen to this 22 minute relaxing meditation whenever needed. It will help you leave the cigarettes behind! 

You can say:

"Alexa, open Stop Smoking Now"
"Alexa, start Stop Smoking Now"
"Alexa, launch Stop Smoking Now"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at alexaskillfeedback@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!!
review: It's a lovely guided meditation that feels like it speaks to so much more than quitting smoking.  And the gentleman's voice is soothing. Thank you...

name: Simple Mobile
description:
Use your Ask Simple Mobile Skill to Add a Service Plan Pin, Hear Your Refill Date, Check on Your Data Usage and Update APN Settings on your Simple Mobile Smartphone.

Have a No-Contract Simple Mobile Smartphone? Then this skill will make it easy for you to get the most out of your smartphone. First, you will need to Enable the skill and enter your Simple Mobile Phone number. Now you are ready to take advantage of this skill.
 
Add Airtime: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to Add Airtime” Alexa will send a text message to your phone to start the process.  It’s that simple.

Refill Date: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile, What is my refill date?” Never miss a cycle date again. Alexa can help you stay connected.

Data Usage: Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to check my Data Usage.” Always know where you stand with Data, so you can enjoy your music, games and apps without worry.

Update APN settings:  Say “Alexa, Ask Simple Mobile to update my APN settings.”  If you are activating your own phone with a Simple Mobile Bring Your Own Phone Kit, Alexa can help you get the right APN settings. Really important, so you can get Data and MMS messages on your phone.

We will be building more features soon, so check simplemobile.com/Alexa for more info.

This skill may not be suitable for all ages. The skill requires a Simple Mobile phone and service. Go to www.simplemobile.com for more details.
review: Simply simple!

name: Audible Clock
description:
Turn your Alexa into any one of a variety of audible clocks, such as a grandfather clock, cuckoo clock, talking clock, and more!  It's a useful, fun, and entertaining way to track the time.



NEW!

Due to popular demand, you can now specify how frequently a clock chimes whenever you choose a clock that normally goes off every quarter hour.

See www.audibleclock.com/FAQ for details, or contact us at info@audibleclock.com with any feedback, questions, or suggestions.

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

This skill works like a long playlist or one of the many "sleep sounds" skills, so you can easily (even accidentally) stop it by asking Alexa to "stop."  In fact, if you ask Alexa to play a song or open a "sleep sounds" skill, Audible Clock will stop so Alexa can play the song or sleep sounds instead.  Audible Clock is easy to restart, of course: just say "Alexa, open Audible Clock" and tell it which clock you want to listen to.

 

 

FUN TIP

Many people dedicate one of their Alexa devices to use as a talking clock.  Simply launch Audible Clock on the chosen Echo and then press the microphone mute button so it won't be accidentally interrupted.

 

 

CLOCK SHOP

Want a clock that meows like a cat?  We've got that.  How about one that sounds like Big Ben, a cow, or even Stephen Hawking?  We've got those too.  We're always adding new clocks so you'll never get bored.

 

To try a new clock while one is already running, just say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a mantle clock" (or another clock of your choice).

 

For a full list of available clocks, visit www.audibleclock.com or say "Alexa, ask Audible Clock for a list of clocks."  We're always adding new clocks, so check back frequently.

 

 

PREMIUM CLOCKS

In addition to its many free clocks, Audible Clock offers a few Premium Clocks you can purchase.  These quality clocks offer higher production values, clearer recordings, and/or an innovative twist on what a clock can be (ever hear a cat "meow" the Westminster Chimes?).  Once purchased, a Premium Clock can be used as many times as you like.

 

 

SUPPORT

Problems or questions?  Because there is no way for us to reply to reviews, please let us help by contacting us directly at info@audibleclock.com with any issues or thoughts on how we can improve the skill.  We'd also love to hear about what new clocks you'd like us to add.

 

If you are enjoying this skill, share your enthusiasm by leaving a 5-star review.  Positive reviews help support the creation of new clocks and features.

 

Another timeless skill from www.thomptronics.com
review: This skill works well but does not work with other skills running. Unlike built-in reminders or alarms that 'pop-up' during music or audio playing this skill will not run. Until that happens I either have to I keep running it again or dedicate an Alexa device to run it exclusively. Also whenever I use one of the voices to say the time it starts stating the time by saying 'TickTock....'. Fortunately for me I have a dedicated Echo just to run this skill which does work as described.

We all go a little mad sometimes.
I wanna play a game.
It's been a funny sort of day, hasn't it?
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I see dead people.
Trust is a tough thing to come by these days.
Meats meat, and a man's gotta eat.
They won't stay dead.
I warned you not to go out tonight.
Humans are such easy prey.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.

These two optional features would make it very easy to play a practical joke on someone by asking Whisper Guy the time and then either leaving the room before the horror quote is whispered or pretending not to hear the horror quote, so I take no responsibility for how you use your newfound power, but enjoy!

If you like it, please leave a nice rating. Thanks!

name: remember this
description:
REMEMBER THIS allows you to create a list of items you want to remember.  Start your list by saying ADD TO LIST followed by the text you wish to add.  Use READ LIST to hear the list. A number is assigned to each item in the list.  To remove an item from the list say DELETE NUMBER n, where n is the number of the item you wish to remove.   You can clear the list by saying CLEAR LIST. You can also renumber the list (which may be helpful after deleting items). HELP and STOP are also available at any time.

REMEMBER THIS was originally written for the visually impaired, who cannot use the standard Alexa To Do skill, because it requires seeing the list to delete items.  The ability to verbally delete items easily was the primary driver for this skill.

name: Stopwatch
description:
A stopwatch can be used for many things: After the start, you can always check the elapsed time (in hours, minutes, seconds). Thus, a stopwatch differs from Alexa’s default timer which rings after a definable period of time (for example, five minutes) or Alexa’s default alarm which rings at a certain time (for example, 8 o'clock).

This stopwatch is characterized by a very simple operation, with which you do not have to remember any commands, since they are announced if necessary. You use the start word, “Alexa, start stopwatch” or “Alexa, open stopwatch” or “Alexa, ask stopwatch” for all functions (start, status, reset, delete). The stopwatch is started without asking the first time or after a deletion. On the next calls the elapsed time is announced in hours, minutes, seconds. The stopwatch then suggests one the following three commands:

- “Restart”: Reset the old time first so the stopwatch starts at zero,
- “Delete”: Deletes the stopwatch so it starts automatically at zero when skill is called again,
- “Continue” or no command: Stopwatch continues.

If there are more than 24 hours between the start and the next query, the stopwatch will be reset automatically the next time you start. This does not require any of the three commands.
comment heading: I found out how to work the stopwatch skill. ...
review:
I found out how to work the stopwatch skill. It is explained in the Skills section of the Alexa app, under the Stopwatch skill.
The syntax is:
Alexa, ask stopwatch to ________
where you can fill in 'start', 'pause', 'resume', or 'delete'

name: Phone Finder
description:
Can't find one of your android devices? It is on silent? This skill saves you: your device will ring with full volume and vibrate. Supports all your android devices!

UPDATE: Phone Finder Premium is now available! You can get the premium experience: Add up to six devices, name them and search for them by name.

In the free version, you can add one device. Connect your phone or tablet and never worry about losing them again.
Simply install the additional helper app on your Android device. You can find it in the Google Play Store. It's real simple:
1. Search for "Phone Finder for Alexa" in the Play Store and install it
2. Start the Alexa Skill: "Alexa, open Phone Finder"
3. Ask Alexa to add a new device
4. Alexa tells you your personal PIN-code. It is also displayed in the Alexa App
5. Open the Android App. Enter your PIN code and press "Activate"
6. Your device status becomes "Active"
7. Done

To add an additional device, just repeat these steps. Now, you can ask any of your Alexas (on the same user account) to find your device. If your device is online, it will quickly start to ring loudly and vibrate.

You can just start the skill without any specific command:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: This use to work but wil no longer after IOS update. It’s connexted but the phone never rings

name: stopwatch
description:
This skill provides a stopwatch for timing arbitrary things.

You just start a stopwatch, and then you can check the status of the watch, restart the watch, or stop it at any point. You can also pause and resume the watch, and it will track the running total duration.

In addition to the explicit commands (start, status, reset, stop, pause, resume), launching the app also acts as a shortcut for managing your watch. Launching the app with no watch will start a new watch, while launching it with a running watch will automatically return your status.

Past reviews have mentioned the verbosity; there is no way for me to improve this as Alexa skills must be invoked by name.

Apologies for the recent disruption, my hosting shut down on me while I was in the hospital. However, I've now moved to paid hosting, and added Pause/Restart!

(Also listed as time keeper, for now).

"Alexa, open Phone Finder". Alexa will ask you whether you would like to add, remove or search for a device. Alternatively, you can start the skill with a more specific command.

DIRECT COMMANDS:

Search for device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and search for my phone"
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder to find my device"

Add a new device:
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and add a new device"

Remove an existing device:
"Alexa, start Phone Finder and remove my phone"


Ask for the PIN code:
"Alexa, ask Phone Finder for my code"
"Alexa, open Phone Finder and give me my PIN"
review: Like most skills if you don't  repeat exactly word for word what Alexa asks for ,she won't  work

name: Any.do
description:
Get More Done with Any.do, the #1 To-do list, Calendar & Reminders App. Now works in perfect harmony with Amazon Alexa.

To get started, enable the Any.do Skill on Alexa, grant Lists read/write permissions and link to Any.do by creating a new account or signing-in to your existing account.

Once connected, your Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will be added as new lists to your Any.do account (at the moment, these are the only lists available on Alexa).
Then just say ‘Alexa, add birthday plans to my To-Do list’ or ‘Alexa, add tomatoes to my Shopping list’.
Your tasks will immediately sync to your Any.do account on mobile, desktop and tablet - so you’ll have it with you anytime, anywhere.

New to Any.do?
Visit https://www.any.do  to download the app and start getting more done!
If you have any questions or issues connecting Alexa with Any.do, please contact customers@any.do
review: I mainly use Alexa/Any.do to make a grocery shopping list - as I'm browsing my kitchen I tell Alexa to add things and she does.  I'm about to move out of my house and the home screen widget makes it super easy to write down quick, "Don't forget" stuff as I'm working on things.  Great app!

name: CommonUnitConversion
description: common unit conversion details like how much is 0 degree Celsius equal to Fahrenheit, how much is 1 megabyte, etc.
comment heading: I commonly must read biological publications where the Celsius temperature ...
review: I commonly must read biological publications where the Celsius temperature is give and will be near the maximum for organism survival. These max temps C vary greatly. Common Unit Conversion sets my North American mind to the temperatures in F that I am familiar with.

name: Burning Man Countdown
description:
This skill contains a single feed, updated in real time, that counts down the number of days until the Man burns. It is read by Alexa as part of the user's Flash Briefing. After enabling the skill, simply ask Alexa for your flash briefing and she will read the countdown along with any other flash briefing updates you have waiting.

Burning Man is a festival organized by the non-profit Burning Man Project every year. This skill is not officially associated with BMORG in any way and uses only public domain information and assets to operate.
review: A short and efficient reminder of home.

name: Super Dice bot
description: Dice bot is a bot that rolls virtual dice for you. Great for extended games of D&D or if you just want a number of out thin air, dice bot can help.
review: Sweet!

name: Just Energy
description: This skill allows existing Just Energy (TX only) customers to ask for their bill details and access multiple accounts.  It also allows user to ask Just Energy for a random energy fact or how to contact us. At the time of enabling the skill, Just Energy will ask for a valid username and password to link the Alexa device to customer's account. These login credentials are the same ones that customers use today to login to our self-service portal. Once account is mapped, customers could ask: “Alexa, ask Just Energy”, the skill will come back with a "welcome" response and identify the mapped customer. Say: "What are my bill details", the skill will respond with the current bill details. Say: "Tell me an energy fact", the skill will respond back with a random energy fact or energy savings tip. Say: “Contact Just Energy”, the skill will respond back with Just Energy’s contact information. Say: "Help", the skill will respond by listing all questions a customer can ask Just Energy.  Say: "Quit" or "Exit", the skill will quit.
review: works the way it said it wood.
